name: Sr. Blockchain Specialist SA, EMEA 🔥
title: Sr. Blockchain Specialist SA, EMEA 🔥
description:
Salary 40,000 - 65,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- · Professional experience architecting/operating solutions built on AWS· Experience communicating effectively across internal and external organizations, for complex mission-critical solutions· Experience with NoSQL and relational database technologies· Experience deploying production-grade blockchain solutions on public cloud platforms· Experience with Hyperledger Fabric and Ethereum blockchain frameworks· Experience with AWS services related to blockchain and databases highly desirable, particularly Amazon Managed Blockchain, AWS Lambda, AWS IoT, Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon S3, Amazon EC2 Container Service, Amazon Kinesi




Responsibilities:

- You will collaborate with our customers to build their next-generation applications using our blockchain technologies. We see customers across a variety of industries including financial services, supply chain, healthcare, and entertainment beginning to leverage blockchain technologies to make it more efficient and transparent to transact and share data.Internally, you will be the voice of the customer, partnering with Business Development, Account Teams and Service Teams, sharing customer needs to help inform the roadmap for Amazon Managed Blockchain service.In this role, your creativity will link technology to tangible solutions, with the opportunity to define or invent cloud-native reference architectures for a variety of use cases.Specialist Solutions Architects are thought leaders in AWS technology and industry trends, as such you will participate in the creation and sharing of best practices, technical content and new reference architectures (e.g. white papers, code samples, blog posts) for Blockchain Technology. You will also advise customers on best practices leveraging Amazon Managed Blockchain services through; workshops, user groups, meetups, public speaking, online videos or conferences.If you can advise AWS customers about the art of the possible, while challenging the impossible, come build the future with us.




Technologies:

- API
- AWS
- Blockchain
- Cloud
- EC2
- IoT
- Java
- NoSQL
- Web
- Golang
- NodeJS



More:

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for a Specialist Solutions Architect for its Amazon Managed Blockchain Service, a fully managed service that makes it easy for customers to create and managed scalable blockchain networks using the popular open source frameworks Hyperledger Fabric and Ethereum.

name: Digital Marketing Executive - Blockchain 🔥
title: Digital Marketing Executive - Blockchain 🔥
description:
Salary 50,000 - 75,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- - Degree in Marketing
- 1 - 5 years of experienceBasic knowledge in blockchain/digital technologies and crypto
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills
- An in-depth understanding of all major social media platforms
- Able to successfully complete responsibilities both independently and in a team setting
- Ability to successfully navigate tight deadlinesExperience with social media, blogging, publications, and e-commerce essentialProblem-solving and decision-making skills
- Strong working knowledge of design, brand development, interactive commerce, and creative process
- Time management and ability to work unsupervised is a must




Responsibilities:

- - Grow and manage communities
- Collect quantitative and qualitative data from marketing campaigns
Assist the creation of content for press releases, blog posts and websites
- Perform market analysis and research on digital technology, social media, and crypto industry trends

- Create actionable plans to both grow and maintain followers through popular social media platforms
- Ensure brand consistency through tone, voice, and terminology.
- Follow analytics, measure growth in followers, write up reports about the quantitative progress of accounts.
- Oversee influencer marketing and influencer relationships.




Technologies:

- Blockchain



More:

Digital Marketing Executive – Blockchain

The successful candidate will earn a competitive salary.The role holder will collaborate cross-functionally with different teams such as Tech Team, Sales and Operations.

name: Senior Data Science Analyst 🔥
title: Senior Data Science Analyst 🔥
description:
Salary 65,000 - 90,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Strong quantitative, mathematical and analytical skills; and ability to understand statistical models (such as those used for demand forecasting)

Strong communication and presentation skills:
ability to explain complex information to technical and non-technical audiences

Demonstrated problem-solving skills:
ability to interpret data and diagnose issues using structured methods Experience working in relational databases (MS SQL Server, Oracle, or equivalent)

Experience creating and using analytic scripts to perform data analysis processes

Achieved advanced degree in Operations Research, Econometrics, Data Science, Mathematics, Physical Sciences or similar quantitative disciplineAwareness of data load and ETL / Automation tools (Informatica, etc.




Responsibilities:

- Learn and develop a solid understanding of Aptos’ demand modelling and optimisation algorithms, and the core set of data science services which we provide to clientsExecute and deliver analytical services for customers, using sales data and Aptos’ AI/ML demand models.
Typical outputs include data-driven recommendations for item or category level pricing strategies; or providing Basket Analysis, Store Clustering or Promotion Performance AnalysisPerform forecast accuracy evaluations on-demand model outputs, and apply model tuning techniques to maximise model accuracyAssist in Value Measurement analysis to demonstrate the value of our price optimization solution for existing customersWork with our Professional Services project implementation teams, especially Price Strategy Consultants, in the delivery of data science services and sharing of analytical insight as part of client projectsCollaborate with other members of the data science teams to help improve existing analytical servicesDevelop new analytical services, leveraging our data science capability to provide solutions to retailers pricing challengesUse a combination of tools including SQL, Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery), Python, Tableau and in-house software




Technologies:

- BigQuery
- Business Intelligence
- Cloud
- ETL
- Machine Learning
- Oracle
- Python
- SQL
- Tableau



More:

Aptos has an immediate opening in our Science Services team for a Senior Data Science Analyst based in Europe.
This individual will work in a fast-paced environment as part of multi-disciplinary project teams to deliver analytical services and data-driven insights to retailers.
The successful candidate will bring a balance of creative problem solving, hands-on data skills, and practical analytical skills to the organization.

title: Cloud Project Manager - Buckinghamshire - OUTSIDE IR35 🔥
description:
Salary 60,000 - 85,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Please note, we are not looking for someone who has delivered 'big data' Azure migrations, the focus is Applications and InfrastructureIt's vital that candidates can demonstrate examples of mitigating potential risks, obstacles and challenges associated with Azure migrations alongside bringing multiple sites (100's) together through large scale connectivity and networking.

- The Azure Project Manager will be working with internal stakeholders and a 3rd party Cloud Vendor to migrate a number of applications and Infrastructure services into Azure.

- Cloud
- IaaS
- Project Manager

description:
Salary 35,000 - 60,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field, or equivalent experience Experience in Objective-C is beneficial Excellent written and oral communication skills (English) Ability to work in a self-driven, complex environment with multiple and changing priorities Ability to focus on deadlines and deliverables Ability to think abstractly Ability and desire to quickly learn new technologies




Responsibilities:

- Maintain and extend existing development activities Work with customers to determine project requirements Design software to fulfill customer requirements Develop software from requirements and specifications Find and repair software defects; unit testing, UI automation testing Stay current with Apple and iOS standards and guidelines Documenting development work done Other duties include project documentation, creating customer software manuals, and developing prototypes for new software technologies




Technologies:

- Objective-C
- TDD
- iOS
- UX UI Design



More:

A Software company based in Centurion/Sandton/Cape Town is currently looking for iOS Developer / Engineer to help design and maintain software applications.

name: CTO / Head of Software Engineering 🔥
title: CTO / Head of Software Engineering 🔥
description:
Salary 50,000 - 75,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- The role reports directory to the CEO and will be a key member of the board, the previous CTO / Technology lead is exiting the business as part of the PE investment and therefore we are looking for board level vision and commercial capability, equally you will be required to work closely with the development teams so hands on architectural and process management capability is a must.
This is not a just a strategy role, the role will require someone to drive and operationally support the team.
To be considered you will ideally have the following background.
Must have worked for a fast growing software house as a CTO or Head of Engineering Have led software development teams in excess of 30 and have demonstrated scaling teams/capability up significantlyHave led significant cultural and process change within a technology environment Have migrated legacy technology to Microsoft Azure Have helped move a development function from customer led solutions to a product development roadmap.
Have worked with and selected development partners to deliver a collaborative solution.
Have the ability to pass SC clearanceHave a very good understanding of how to build a software solution with high degrees of security built into the platform Experience in delivering solutions in the classified information market would be a significant advantage.




Responsibilities:

- You will have the responsibility of leading two tech teams, spanning 6 software products developed over two distinct technology stacks.
These teams are distributed across two UK locations but with the PE house ready to support growth, there is the opportunity to add more resource through acquisition and hiring.
They operate in a market very well positioned to thrive in our current economic and political climate and have a strong reputation in that market, one of the key things holding them back from significant growth is the technology is limiting their capability.
They are now looking to sensibly invest in moving both the platforms and the processes forward.
From a technical perspective the current landscape is Microsoft and Java/Oracle - there are plans to move both platforms forward so it is important you are capable of leading multiskilled development groups.
There is significant work to do in the Microsoft world so any experience of delivering Microsoft Development and Azure Dev Ops solutions will be a distinct advantage.




Technologies:

- Azure
- Java
- Oracle
- Security
- Cloud



More:

Well established, recently PE backed software tech business who are looking to transform their software Development and Operations function, therefore are looking for a new CTO to lead them into this new exciting period.

name: ETAS Embedded Software Engineer 🔥
title: ETAS Embedded Software Engineer 🔥
location: Bird Hall Lane/Orion Business Park, Manchester
description:
Salary 40,000 - 65,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- A background in embedded software development in C is essential.
Experience of automotive applications, ideally based on the AUTOSAR framework.
You will be an effective, creative and enthusiastic problem solver.
You will be a confident communicator who feels at ease presenting technical information to experts and non-experts alike.
You will be self-reliant, and approachable.




Responsibilities:

- You will provide technical support for customers representing well-known automotive manufacturers, as well as for internal users.
You will track, investigate and respond to problem reports and enquiries, reproducing customer configurations and diagnosing faults.
You will analyse specifications and define requirements for software developers.
You will also have the opportunity to develop software yourself.
You will have, and continue to develop, a broad understanding of many aspects of automotive software, from deeply-embedded platforms to high-level applications and tools.




Technologies:

- Bash
- Embedded
- JIRA
- Python
- Ruby



More:

You will be a member of the development team for our successful AUTOSAR Basic Software product, providing a link to Product Managers and Field Application Engineers in our global support organization.

name: UX Designer 🔥
title: UX Designer 🔥
description:
Salary 35,000 - 60,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Good user focus to deliver great products that the business’s customers love and compelling services that will deliver their strategic goalsExperience in collaborating with key stakeholders to identify opportunities, hypotheses or question and hypotheses to ensure the work delivers value to the business and customersExperience of working in customer-orientated user experience design projects, and the tools necessary to produce that work (Sketch)Experience of dual track agile methodologyDemonstrate developing and documenting ideas, flows, designs and propositions to engage with the business’s customersKnowledge of Lean UX, Lean startup, Design Thinking and dual track agile




Responsibilities:

- The company are going through significant growth, and with technology at the heart of their products this UX Designer will play a key part in improving the user experience and overall customer journey through product design across a range of web and mobile applications, through to UI and Visual Design.
As a UX Designer you will have experience working across the full design lifecycle, taking UI and Visual Design into consideration when crafting the UX to create an awesome customer experience.
You'll be passionate about building creative solutions and working within a collaborative team to produce innovative technology products which are set to revolutionise the industry.
Ideally you will demonstrate a technical background working with HTML and CSS, with experience working in an agile environment and exposure to Sketch, Framer or Figma would be extremely advantageous.




Technologies:

- CSS
- Figma
- Mobile
- Sketch
- Web
- UX UI Design



More:

Burns Sheehan are exclusively partnering with a market leading technology business who featured in the Times 100 best companies to work for, to hire a UX Designer to join their Product Design team in London.

name: Blockchain Engineer 🔥
title: Blockchain Engineer 🔥
description:
Salary 35,000 - 60,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- In order to be considered for this role, you will be required to have the following qualifications, skills and experience:
At least masters degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics, or equivalent experience and at least one year experience leading a team of developers.
Mastering major cryptographic concepts and passionate about using zero knowledge proofs as a privacy-preserving and scalable technology.
Expert in Solidity, Go, familiarity with Rust is a plus.
Deep knowledge of Ethereum, familiarity with its rivals.




Responsibilities:

- Duties will include to:
Design and build blockchain components that power the open-software ecosystem and at the same time enable deployment massive commercial solutions on top of it.
Foresee optimal technical approaches and associated risks.
Lead the development team.
Keep up to date with the latest developments in blockchain technology and grow internal knowledge base.
Closely collaborate with internal and external experts within various technical.




Technologies:

- Blockchain
- Rust
- Golang



More:

CK Group are recruiting for a Blockchain Engineer to join an exciting blockchain technology start up enabling enterprise to bridge the divide between digital decentralized technologies and the transfer and trade of physical goods.

name: CTO (Blockchain) 🔥
title: CTO (Blockchain) 🔥
description:
Salary 45,000 - 70,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Experience at a senior leadership level
Proven success working closely with product management, contributing to the product strategy and successfully delivering on the product roadmap
Extensive experience in hiring strategies to assemble and manage top-quality development teams
Clear understanding ofblockchain technology concepts and operation, in-depth knowledge of Ethereum is a plus

Hire and assign personnel to projects
Develop Agile cultureOversee daily workflows and performance/happiness of teams

title: Lead Cloud Platform Engineer (London or Midlands) 🔥

- Strong AWS experience & skillsConfident in using PythonStrong Terraform experienceExposure to DevOps practicesProven track record of delivering goalsUse of Agile Development MethodologiesLeadership & Strong Communication SkillsMy client offers a rewarding experience of working with the best minds in the industry, delivering exceptional network performance and visibility for any application.

name: CTO - UK North SP 🔥
title: CTO - UK North SP 🔥
description:
Salary 60,000 - 85,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Who You Are The ideal candidate will have an extensive experience of working with Service Providers and will have held similar roles in the past.
They should have a consistent record of innovation and be able to adapt their conversations to all levels of an organisation’s hierarchy.
Skills in software, datacentre, virtualisation and automation are desirable as well as proven commercial acumen.




Responsibilities:

- You will be encouraged to provide architectural leadership towards the customer, delivering a multi-year future strategy to drive and exceed their current business objectives.
You will not only be positioning today’s solutions but also defining future joint technology requirements that Cisco could develop to drive the customer relationship forwards.
Who You'll Work With You will work extensively with the customer, both virtually and ideally face to face, and the role will require extensive travel within Europe and to the US (Post COVID).
The role is ideally based in the UK, Nordics or Benelux.
You will need to collaborate with the wider account teams and Cisco development teams to define our strategy.
Who You Are The ideal candidate will have an extensive experience of working with Service Providers and will have held similar roles in the past.




Technologies:

- Cisco
- Network
- Security



More:

What You'll Do We are looking for an experienced CTO leader for SP Infrastructure to work with our UK/Nordics/Benelux Service Provider accounts.
The successful applicant will work closely with both our Product, Services and Business Unit teams to ensure a consistent architectural approach is defined and delivered to our customer with sustainable and unique business value.

name: Backend Ruby Engineer - Build a safety net 🔥
title: Backend Ruby Engineer - Build a safety net 🔥
description:
Salary 45,000 - 70,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- We’re looking for someone who wants to make a positive difference in society by improving the financial health of over 3 million users worldwide.
We are acutely aware of the position of many of our customers and our role in trying to help and serve them.
This means you take the initiative.
You are a passionate doer.
You own our problems and are always learning.
You have used Ruby on Rails in a job for at least 2 years.




Responsibilities:

- You'll be joining our Core (Financial Health) - Build a safety net squad where the team’s mission is to put our users on the road to financial fitness by building a safety net.
This is not a short-term, one-shot approach.
This is about building long term behavior change.
We will act as our users’ money personal trainer, helping them to build a healthy savings habit.
Life as an Engineer at Cleo We don’t deliberate exhaustively over all the what-ifs.
We focus on being effective.
We make small changes and test them quickly.
We think the deliberate, conscious and careful accumulation of tech debt is a powerful tool that lets us ship code and value to our users faster.
We write code to be read, debugged and maintained by humans.
We help each other.
We learn the best and quickest by reviewing each others’ code and giving each other useful, constructive feedback.
Watch this to dive a little deeperWe believe that you should work on problems that inspire you.
Our current product squads focus on the following problems:
Squids:
focus on activation and building useful financial toolsMoney:
focus improve users financial health by improving access to our financial product Boost:




Technologies:

- Backend
- REST
- Rails
- Ruby
- SQL



More:

We’re looking for a brilliant backend Ruby engineer to join us on our mission to fight for the world's financial health.

name: Product Marketing Lead 🔥
title: Product Marketing Lead 🔥
description:
Salary 35,000 - 60,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Good analytic skills

Extensive experience in a similar role with demonstrable impact on sales performance

Played a leading role in bringing new products to market successfully

Can showcase competitor analysis and how that insight has been used to drive commercial success

Strong leadership and communication skills

Able to present a business case to senior stakeholders and secure buy in




Responsibilities:

- That our GTM models reflect our position in our target markets.
You’ll know how to keep it simple for sales teams and our customersYou’ll simplify how we build and launch new products so that our sales teams can sell them to our awesome customers really easilyManage the customer experience of commercial interaction, so we need you to get them to love our proposals, quotes, and invoicesUnderstanding how our products are being used so we can monetize and increase the value of specific featuresMaking recommendations for product strategy across our portfolio, and be comfortable trying different commercial activities in different sectors and geographies

-



More:

We’re looking for someone who loves getting customers to buy our products.
Someone who is creative with data and numbers to make us a more thoughtful product marketing machine and support the roll out of commercial activities that will help our sales teams win deals.

name: Field CTO 🔥
title: Field CTO 🔥
description:
Salary 60,000 - 80,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Ability to interact with and influence senior executives within Cloudera’s key EMEA Enterprise accounts, at both a strategic level with the C-suite, and at a deeper technical level with technical stakeholders.
Recent industry experience and deep technical background in the major hyperscale public cloud providers, streaming, data warehousing, machine learning, private cloud and kubernetes architectures.
Ability to act as an industry thought leader in both customer meetings and public settings and be the key spokesperson in the EMEA region.
The ideal candidate will be a well-rounded Subject Matter Expert (SME) that has the technical depth to confidently present in front of audiences of all sizes.
Experience in demonstrating thought leadership through speaking engagements, blogs, books and other public facing materials.
Understand and communicate the value proposition of strategic and tactical concepts for complex industry use cases.
Work cross-functionally with the sales, pre-sales, professional services, engineering and marketing teams to accelerate Cloudera’s business and drive customer success.
Stay close to industry trends in order to gain a deeper product understanding of the direction of data management.
Fluent verbal and written English language skills, and visual communication and presentation skills.
A second major EMEA language is a plus.
Ability to travel up to 60%Engineering or Computer Science Bachelor's Degree or 10+ years of relevant industry experience.




Responsibilities:

-
The role requires dynamic and engaging communications and presentation skills; verbal, written and visual.
The successful candidate is someone able to engage and influence a varied audience, from C-level to managerial as well as internal product and engineering teams, and extract information that can be used by the sales team in future engagements.
While based in Singapore, frequent travel across EMEA and occasional international travel is required.




Technologies:

- Cloud
- Kubernetes
- Machine Learning
- Security



More:

We empower people to transform complex data into clear and actionable insights.
Cloudera delivers an enterprise data cloud for any data, anywhere, from the Edge to AI.
Powered by the relentless innovation of the open source community, Cloudera advances digital transformation for the world’s largest enterprises.
Learn more at cloudera.com

Confidently join the hundreds of enterprises already running reliable, production applications on Quorum.

name: Google Cloud Platform (GCP) Systems Architect 🔥
title: Google Cloud Platform (GCP) Systems Architect 🔥
description:
Salary 60,000 - 80,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Hands-on GCP delivery experience in a Lead Engineer/Architect/Lead Architect or Director level role
Ideally Google Cloud Certified
Multi-tier distributed architecture experience within IT consulting, IT operations, application development or support which includes migrating, architecting, operating on premises and cloud-based solutions, or experience transforming legacy IT solutions, and working knowledge of software development tools and methodologies
Avid technologist, with deep expertise in modern cloud architecture and history of successful implementation of complex GCP solutions
Experience architecting, designing, migrating workloads to the public cloud
Depth in various migration techniques such as rehost, refactor, re-architect, re-platform, repurchase, etc
Deep expertise in public and private cloud hybrid architecture, networking and connectivity
Fluency with design of deployment, configuration management automation (CI/CD), security automation (SAST/DAST), IT operations automation (AIOps) for different workload’s types




Responsibilities:

- Work closely with business in identifying solution requirements and key case-studies/scenarios for the future solution
Enable GCP cloud journey, analyse TCO and create a business case, make the Cloud dream become reality
Design and prototype cloud infrastructure, create infrastructure and security architecture document covering deep technical aspects of the implementation
Create a unified strategy for cloud transformation governance, automation, security, implementation and operations
Analyse existing application and IT services portfolios, develop assets’ migration, transformation and automation roadmap
Conduct cloud infrastructure architecture review/audit and create review/audit report
Lead implementation of the solution from establishing project requirements and goals to solution "go-live"
Oversee the cloud system engineering efforts and provide technical help as needed
Participate in the full cycle of pre-sale activities, including RFP processing, proposal development and direct communications with potential clients
Maintain a strong understanding of industry trends and best practices
Create thought leadership on cloud solutions and hybrid clouds
Serve as a cloud evangelist, consult and provide technical guidance on cloud solutions design, build, governance, security, operations and cost control best practices




Technologies:

- CI/CD
- Cloud
- GCP
- Security
- Golang



More:


Are you an industry visionary and technologist at heart with a passion for designing complex Cloud solutions? Are you able to guide and advise business and IT teams on the technical and organisational challenges of Cloud transformation? Do you have strong soft skills, solid stakeholder management and technology governance experience? Do you want to transform businesses, so they are able to operate and grow successfully in the cloud-first world?

Then you have an opportunity to join us as a Google Cloud Systems Architect to work with highly skilled and engaged teams across the globe in fast paced projects.

name: Technical Director, Office of the CTO 🔥
title: Technical Director, Office of the CTO 🔥
description:
Salary 50,000 - 70,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Professional experience in either software, hardware, or infrastructure engineering that includes technical innovation and engineering leadership.
Experience co-creating roadmaps for cloud platforms at the CIO, CTO, or SVP of Engineering level.
Ability to travel up to 50% of the time.




Responsibilities:

- As the Technical Director in the Office of the CTO, you will create and reinforce the human pathways between Google Engineering and our most strategic customers and partners, allowing all of us to start from loosely defined, potentially transformative market opportunities and convert them into new, technology-enabled businesses.
You will help our customers create their future and help us create the future of Google by continuously tuning our innovation system to the needs of the world’s most complex enterprises.
Google is and always will be an engineering company.
We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users.
At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world.




Technologies:

- Android
- Cloud



More:

The Office of the CTO is a diverse team of engineers and technologists working on behalf of the Google Cloud CEO, whose mission is to foster collaborative innovation between Google and prominent organizations.

Experience co-creating roadmaps for cloud platforms at the CIO, CTO, or SVP of Engineering level.
Ability to travel up to 50% of the time.




Responsibilities:

- As the Technical Director in the Office of the CTO, you will create and reinforce the human pathways between Google Engineering and our most strategic customers and partners, allowing all of us to start from loosely defined, potentially transformative market opportunities and convert them into new, technology-enabled businesses.
You will help our customers create their future and help us create the future of Google by continuously tuning our innovation system to the needs of the world’s most complex enterprises.
Google is and always will be an engineering company.
We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users.
At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world.




Technologies:

- Android
- Cloud



More:

The Office of the CTO is a diverse team of engineers and technologists working on behalf of the Google Cloud CEO, whose mission is to foster collaborative innovation between Google and prominent organizations.

name: Senior SW Developer (Cloud) 🔥
title: Senior SW Developer (Cloud) 🔥
description:
Salary 45,000 - 70,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Confident with Cloud & On Prem Architecture

Comfortable leading discussions with internal & external clients

As a naturally creative thinker you can design and deliver end to end solutions

Ideally you will be capable of working independently or as part of a multi-disciplined team, supporting the Development Practice Lead along with managing resources and plans internal to Logiq.

description:

- They’re looking for strong coding skills, a love for problem solving and a passionate, enthusiastic attitude.

The company encourage people to think openly about problems, challenge conventional thinking and possess a mindset of continuous improvement.

- Python

title: Site Reliability Software Engineer 🔥
description:
Salary 45,000 - 70,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- A BS or MS in Computer Science, or equivalent.
Identifies solutions to knowledge of server hardware and software configuration, networking, standard internet services, scripting languages, cloud computing patterns, technology security and compliance.
Experience running large scale customer facing web services.
Identifies solutions to understanding of load balancing technologies and experience with development in programming languages, databases and big data stores, and container technologies.
Work involves defining and documenting technical architecture of complex and highly scalable products.
A minimum of 5+ years experience of running large scale customer facing web services.




Responsibilities:

- Design, write, and deploy software to improve the availability, scalability, and efficiency of Oracle products and services.
Design and develop designs, architectures, standards, and methods for large-scale distributed systems.
Facilitate service capacity planning and demand forecasting, software performance analysis, and system tuning.
Work with Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) team on the shared full stack ownership of a collection of services and/or technology areas.
Understand the end-to-end configuration, technical dependencies, and overall behavioural characteristics of production services.
Responsible for the design and delivery of the mission critical stack, with focus on security, resiliency, scale, and performance.




Technologies:

- API
- Big Data
- Bash
- Cloud
- DevOps
- LESS
- Linux
- Load Balancing
- Network
- Oracle
- Python
- Security
- Terraform
- Unix
- Web

OCI is committed to providing the best in cloud products that meet the needs of our customers who are tackling some of the world’s biggest challenges.
We offer unique opportunities for smart, hands-on engineers with the expertise and passion to solve difficult problems in distributed highly available services and virtualized infrastructure.

name: Junior Software Developer Cloud 🔥
title: Junior Software Developer Cloud 🔥
description:
Salary 20,000 - 45,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- This role is ideally suited to someone with a good Bachelor’s degree or Masters conversion in a software-related subject (or equivalent experience) and around 3 to 6 years commercial experience as a software engineer/developer.
While we don’t stipulate hard minimum requirements, a suitable baseline might include:
BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field involving coding or equivalent practical experience.
Knowledge of modern Java and experience with scripting languages such as Python, etc.
Solid knowledge of data structures, algorithms, operating systems, and distributed systems fundamentals.
Systematic problem-solving approach, strong communication skills, a sense of ownership and drive.
Experience and knowledge around cloud infrastructure would be great and a definite plus but not essential.




Responsibilities:

- Writing backend code in Java, Python, Golang / Go or another modern programming language.
Writing frontend code in React and JavaScript/TypeScript.
Working with containerisation and virtualisation technologies such as Docker, containerd and Kubernetes.
Automating lifecycle operations for your project:
build, test, health check, deploy, upgrade etc.
Deploying and operating your software in data-centres across the globe.
Analysing, diagnosing and debugging issues across a full breadth of our stackDebug, maintain and improve existing systems, with a focus on performance and reducing operational burden.
Scaling our operations by building tooling and automation.
Participating in the software engineering community at Oracle and beyond.




Technologies:

- API
- Backend
- Cloud
- Docker
- Frontend
- Golang
- IaaS
- Java
- JavaScript
- Kubernetes
- LESS
- Oracle
- Python
- React
- Security
- TypeScript



More:

Oracle’s product engineering teams are building critical services within Oracle’s next-generation public cloud infrastructure known as Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) [0].
These services provide the foundation for businesses around the world as well as Oracle’s Cloud (SaaS) Applications.

name: iOS Developer (Remote Uk / EU) 🔥
title: iOS Developer (Remote Uk / EU) 🔥
description:
Salary 25,000 - 50,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- You’ll have 2-4 years (or more) experience developing iOS/mobile applications - if you’ve worked with Android previously, but know your way around Swift, you’ll be just fine.
When it comes to tackling tricky problems, you’re not one to shy away and look for the easy way out.
You’re not scared to make your ideas known and your voice heard.
If you’re someone who wants to grow into a role, they can make that happen and give you all the support you need along the way.




Responsibilities:

- Currently the tech team is 9 people across android, iOS and the back end, expanding to 13 in the coming months.
The plan is to upgrade and refactor much of the app so the first 4-5 months will allow for learning the product ready for everyone to start working on new functionality and features come summertime.
The CTO likes to be as democratic as possible.
Everyone is valued and their culture is one that promotes the sharing of fresh ideas, ownership, and a real sense of belonging.
When you’re developing technology that impacts lives, you’ll often need to think outside of the box, and they know that you need freedom in order to do that.
You’re not chained to one spot here, either.




Technologies:

- Android
- Mobile
- Swift
- iOS



More:

Failure often comes down to rehashing a product that’s been done a thousand times.
But it’s great when an established app made by a small company still retains that close-knit, start-up culture that can be fast moving and supportive at the same time.
So, what if there was a company out there that are developing apps that genuinely improve the quality of life for users?A company that has built a platform backed by scientific evidence, focusing on improving physical and mental health outcomes for any user, even the ones using the app purely for leisure.
Currently the tech team is 9 people across android, iOS and the back end, expanding to 13 in the coming months.

description:

- – Hands on, demonstrable experience of designing solutions for feature requirements in the Agile Scrum teams and translating these into high quality code– Expert iOS development knowledge with Objective-C, Swift, XCode, Cocoa– Applied knowledge of software engineer best practice and multiple software development methodologies. e.g. XP, Scrum– Applied knowledge of design patterns with simple succinct and clean code and principles of Test Driven Development on iOS and the benefits that are realised.

- – Design, develop and test features in new iPhone and iPad applications– Create application architectures that scale predictably, facilitate development across multiple developers and teams and promote maintainability and extensibility.
– Follow software delivery principles and guidelines based on internal Sky standards and industry best-practices.
– Ensure that design, development and testing activities adhere to these guidelines.
– Create prototypes of new technologies across iOS devices.
– Enables and executes continual improvement across people and systems – Takes pride and ownership in work– Influence business decisions (and be influenced)– Identifies and pre-empts potential conflict, ensuring continued collaboration.

- GitLab
- Mobile
- Objective-C
- Swift
- XP
- iOS
- TDD
- Golang
- UX UI Design

title: Embedded C/ C++ Software Engineer 🔥
description:
Salary 40,000 - 65,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- The ideal Embedded C/C++ Engineer will have experience in a wide range of software technologies, with strong C++/ OO design expertise using UML and C++ for both embedded and desktop environments.
Suitable Embedded C/C++ Software Engineers will have experience that includes developing software to drive hardware devices, and development of desktop-based user interfaces, preferably using the Qt framework.
Practical experience in Agile would be advantageous, as would experience with embedded/real-time Linux.




Responsibilities:

- As part of a small team, your role will involve a wide range of activities, through all aspects of the software lifecycle.
The successful Embedded C/C++ Software Engineer will work closely with Principal Software Engineer, as well as Hardware and RF engineers, to both maintain existing products, and to specify and develop new products.
An understanding of the RF environment and experience in using appropriate tools, such as logic analysers, oscilloscopes and spectrum analysers would be valuable.




Technologies:

- Embedded
- Linux
- Qt
- UML
- Windows



More:

name: Research Fellow in Federated Machine Learning and Blockchain 🔥
title: Research Fellow in Federated Machine Learning and Blockchain 🔥
description:
Salary 45,000 - 70,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- We are looking to recruit an excellent researcher with core skills in machine learning (particularly in deep convnets) and knowledge of blockchain and distributed ledger technology (DLT).
Strong software implementation skills (e.g. Python) are required to interact with other developers on the project to integrate their research into a live prototype system for trial.




Responsibilities:

- The project will investigate federated machine learning (FML) methods, to train novel AI models (e.g. for Computer Vision or other signal processing applications) across distributed private data stores.
The aim of the project is to investigate, develop and demonstrate new ways to enable FML using distributed ledgers and blockchain technology to create trusted shared AI models from private data.
The successful candidate will work alongside experts in Machine Learning and Distributed Ledgers within DECaDE and the broader CVSSP centre, and interact remotely with industry collaborators to communicate research outcomes as well as potentially assist in the co-supervision of PhD students in this area.




Technologies:

- Blockchain
- Computer Vision
- Machine Learning
- Python



More:

The Centre for Vision Speech and Signal Processing (CVSSP) at the University of Surrey seeks to recruit an outstanding postdoctoral researcher in the fields of Federated Machine Learning / Deep Learning.

Funded by the Interreg NWE Blockstart project, the post will also feed into the EPSRC research centre DECaDE:
Centre for the Decentralized Digital Economy, which is exploring the fusion of Artificial Intelligence and Distributed Ledger Technology / Blockchain for exploration of decentralized platforms in the emerging data economy

name: React Developer 🔥
title: React Developer 🔥
description:
Salary 40,000 - 65,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- * UI Security patterns and best practices
* AWS frameworks
* CI/CD (Git or Gitlab preferred)
* App lifecycle (publishing/updating on iOS/Android stores)
* User metric measurement
* Experience in chart libraries / data visualisation




Responsibilities:

- *We're a fin-tech startup looking to expand our team with a really strong and productive React Developer for a 90% remote role.
* The successful candidate will play a critical role in bringing the Illio wealth management platform to market and helping it scale in terms of features, functionality, engagement and users.
Initially this will be extending our React web application and our React Native mobile app.
After that the roadmap is pretty extensive and wide-ranging, so the ability to quickly pick up new tools is essential.
* The existing codebase is also extremely complex and a mix of React, Typescript and Redux so experience of these and the ability to ‘unstick’ others is important.
* It’s a startup and we’re still in the relatively early stages so we need people who have a solid work ethic and can-do attitude.
Cultural fit is important, we operate a pretty flat structure with everyone able to contribute to all areas of the business according to their experience and strengths.
* The successful employee will have to be a self-starter, you’ll be given a lot of responsibility early that will materially impact the success of the company, so we need people who have a reputation for productivity and quality.
* You need to be a continuous learner as we’re open to introducing new tech and trying new things (in fact we have to) so we want people who are curious and capable and then good at sharing knowledge and ideas with others.




Technologies:

- AWS
- Android
- CI/CD
- CSS
- Git
- GitLab
- Kotlin
- Mobile
- PostgreSQL
- REST
- React
- React Native
- Redux
- Security
- Spring
- TDD
- TypeScript
- Web
- iOS
- UX UI Design
- Cloud



More:

At illio, we believe that we can change the wealth management industry by empowering advisors with data.
For over 2 years our team of financial executives has been working with leading fintech industry experts to develop illio into a state-of-the-art platform.
Our user-friendly platform allows you to holistically view all your clients’ portfolios, across all asset classes in one place, so that you can make confident, well-informed investment decisions.

Prototype and build proof of concept embedded systems
Develop unit, system verification, and functional tests
Put in place documentation templates and processes
Manage multiple projects in parallel
Work as part of a team to create project specification documents and work package estimates
Identify and explore new technologies, techniques, processes, and tools that could be leveraged for future projects




Technologies:

- Bluetooth
- Embedded
- IoT
- Java
- NFC
- Python
- UX UI Design



More:

Orvio is an award-winning electronics design+development house, working with a highly dynamic approach to take market-disrupting products from concept to manufacture.
With a strong focus in the IoT (Internet of Things), low-power connectivity, and sensor systems, we work closely with our customers to solve real-world problems across a wide range of areas.
We pride ourselves in our flexibility and determination to deliver creative and innovative solutions.

name: iOS Developer (Remote, UK Based) 🔥
title: iOS Developer (Remote, UK Based) 🔥
description:
Salary 45,000 - 55,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- At least 1 year of professional experience in iOS.

Hands on experience developing iOS apps (personal projects or through studies)

Proficient with Swift 4 and iOS frameworks.

Applied knowledge of design patterns and SOLID principles.

Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect iOS applications to back-end services.

Experience of developing user interfaces with auto-layout and collaborating with UX/UI designer.

Working knowledge of the general mobile landscape, architecture, trends, and emerging technologies.

Experience with modern design patterns such as MVP, MVVM, VIPER etc.




Responsibilities:

- The position will be responsible for supporting the Lead iOS Developer to work on the iOS application. You will help to create a reliable application that makes investing simple and enjoyable for users. You will be involved in the whole life cycle from suggesting new features to releasing the application:

Design and build applications for the iOS platform.

Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.

Collaborate with the wider team to define, design, and ship new features.

Identify and fix bottlenecks and bugs.

Help maintain code quality and organisation.




Technologies:

- iOS
- API
- Swift



More:

We are building a financial service that people love. We are looking for a mid-level iOS Developer, who will be responsible for the development and maintenance of the Moneybox app.

Your primary focus will be development of iOS applications and their integration with back-end services. You will be working alongside a team of engineers and developers working on different layers of the infrastructure. Therefore, a commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and the creation of quality products is essential.

name: Junior QA Engineer 🔥
title: Junior QA Engineer 🔥
description:
Salary 25,000 - 35,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- 1-2 years QA experience with a broad knowledge of best practices is essential.

Demonstrable test framework implementations on more than one tech stack.

Deep understanding of SQL, jQuery, XML, REST/JSON).

Deep understanding of web, API & database testing technologies and frameworks.

Experience in test data design and implementation strategies.

Experience with API test framework design for legacy back-end systems.

Experience coaching junior members of a QA team.

Experience of Agile Scrum, Kanban & behavioural-driven development (BDD).

Experience of build pipelines using common CI/CD and SCM tools (e.g. GIT, Jenkins, TeamCity).

Experience with automated testing incl. compatibility & performance testing an advantage.




Responsibilities:

- Review technical and business requirements (incl. acceptance criteria) and design robust & reusable test scenarios.

Manage the execution of test scenarios and report results, capturing run & amp; key metrics overtime.

Design and implement strategic level QA documentation/frameworks for the Cloud Apps workstream.

Integrate Cloud Apps test scenarios with the overall test & automation strategy.

Design and execute testing for complex features as required.

Act as a point of contact for QA issues that arise during testing of the Cloud Apps workstream.

Support the organisational shift towards continuous testing delivery (incl. implementing automated testing frameworks).

Analyse live issues with a focus on continuous improvement.

Assess feature suitability for test automation (incl. unit tests for developers & amp; API integration tests)

Configuration and set-up of test tools including the integration of automated regression suite with CI/CD pipeline tools.

Log, prioritise & track bugs to completion.

Maintaining documentation related to the QA stream.

Create and maintain strong working relationships, working closely with other teams to ensure issues are progressed.

Collaborate across the wider team, predominantly with the development, product & amp; UX teams.

Support other QA workstreams (e.g. Mobile & amp; Platform) with test execution during busy periods.

Attending daily stand-ups, sprint planning, refinement sessions & retrospectives as required.

As a key member of the QA team you’ll help ensure the quality of products and improve existing QA processes. Reporting into the QA lead.




Technologies:

- QA Testing
- Mobile
- API



More:

We are looking for a QA engineer to join our team, who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment. You will be working with a high calibre team to continuously develop new products/features.

Please read before you apply!
By sending us your application you acknowledge and agree to Moneybox using your personal data as described below.
We collect applicants’ personal data to manage our recruitment related activities. title: Software Developer in Test (SDET) 🔥

Requirements:

- Extensive SDET experience (3+ years) with a broad knowledge of best practices is essential.

Experience in large system migrations is essential.

Experience in test data design and implementation strategies.

Experience with API test framework design for legacy back-end systems.

Demonstrable test framework implementations on more than one tech stack.

Support other QA workstreams (e.g. Mobile & Cloud Apps) with test execution during busy periods.

Attending daily stand-ups, sprint planning, refinement sessions & retrospectives as required.

As a key member of the QA team you’ll help ensure the quality of products, improve existing QA processes and mentor others. Reporting into the QA lead.

- Teamcity

name: Senior Android Developer 🔥
title: Senior Android Developer 🔥
description:
Salary 60,000 - 70,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- 5+ years of commercial experience in Android development.

Experience and desire to mentor and support other developers with their technical and professional development.

Exposure to all aspects of software development from gathering requirements to releasing with the ability to take ownership of these aspects.

Highly proficient in Kotlin.

Experience with common design patterns such as MVVM.

Experience using common libraries such as RxJava2, Dagger, Retrofit etc.

Knowledge of reactive programming using RxJava or Coroutines.

Experience creating rich mobile interfaces.

Extensive knowledge of the mobile landscape, architecture, trends and emerging technologies.




Responsibilities:

- The position will be responsible for supporting the Lead Android Developer working on the Android application. You will help to create a reliable application that makes investing simple and enjoyable for users. You will be involved in the whole life cycle from suggesting new features to releasing the application:

Develop new features and maintain the Moneybox Android application

Lead development and take ownership for streams of work that enable customers to reach their financial goals.

Mentor and support members of the Android team.

Interact with the product manager and designers to refine ideas into fully specified user stories, that define how the user will interact with the application.

Help to suggest new features for the application that will make the app experience better for users, and that will make the application more reliable.

Break down stories into manageable chunks that allow features to be developed in an iterative manner that allow us to release regularly so we can gain feedback from our users.

Estimate features so that we can get a reliable release date estimate for the rest of the company and users.

Support the design of the architecture of the android application. Lead large scale improvements to the design of the application.

Release the app when all the features for the release have been developed.

Monitor the app post-release to ensure that it is working as expected.




Technologies:

- Android
- RxJs
- Dagger
- Kotlin



More:

We are currently growing at a rapid pace with more and more people using Moneybox. To support this growth we are looking for an Android Developer to help develop and own parts of the android application. This role will be responsible for working within a dedicated team to develop the Moneybox Android app. You will work alongside other developers to maintain a high quality app and develop new features that enhance the overall experience.

name: Senior Software Engineer, Investment Platform 🔥
title: Senior Software Engineer, Investment Platform 🔥
description:
Salary 65,000 - 80,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Computer science or similar related experience.

Proven track record in a similar role.

Thorough understanding of OO programming languages.

Thorough understanding of relational databases.

Strong analytical and problem solving skills.

Able to work both individually and as part of an agile team.

Able to actively participate in technical and commercial discussions.




Responsibilities:

- This role will be responsible for but not limited to the following:

Participating in the entire application lifecycle, focusing on developing scalable, resilient systems that deliver business value.

Writing unit / integration tests along with production code to produce a reliable product.

Working with wider team of developers, QA testers, product managers, UX designers to create and build new features.

Understanding and providing feedback for technical and design requirements.

Providing technical support to internal teams.

Staying abreast of and (where necessary) applying the latest emerging technologies.

Helping improve code quality and existing functionality.




Technologies:

- .NET Core
- ASP.NET
- Azure
- C#
- Git
- SQL
- Teamcity
- Cloud



More:

We are currently growing at a rapid pace with more and more people using Moneybox. To support this growth we are looking for an all-rounder in full stack development. We don’t expect you to be an expert in everything, but a fundamental understanding of how things work is important.
This role will be responsible for working within a small team to further develop our investment platform which manages the investment activities for hundreds of thousands of investors.

Our tech stack:
C# / .NET Core
ASP.NET Core, Hangfire, MediatR, xUnit
Microsoft Azure
Sql Server
Git, TeamCity and Octopus Deploy

Such transfers may include for example transfers and/or disclosures outside the European Economic Area and in the United States of America.
If you are unsuccessful in your application, we may keep your details on file so that we can tell you about other suitable vacancies which may be of interest to you when they arise in the future. name: Senior Software Engineer, Cloud Apps 🔥
title: Senior Software Engineer, Cloud Apps 🔥
description:
Salary 65,000 - 80,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Computer science or similar related experience.

Proven track record in a similar role.

Thorough understanding of:

OO programming languages.

Relational databases.

APIs delivered over HTTP

Strong analytical and problem solving skills.

Able to work both individually and as part of an agile team.

Able to actively participate in technical and commercial discussions.

Experience of one or more of:

Defining system or module architectures that have been delivered into real-world use.

Line management of a small engineering team.

Coaching and mentoring other engineers.

Scrum-master / agile team leadership.

Defining, documenting, and implementing technology standards.




Responsibilities:

- This role will be responsible for but not limited to the following:

Participating in the entire application lifecycle, focusing on designing and developing scalable, resilient systems that deliver business value.

Managing, coaching, and mentoring an engineering team

Owning technical solution design architecture for significant product features, software modules, and technical initiatives.

Hands-on coding

Writing unit / integration tests along with production code to produce a reliable product.

Working with wider team of developers, QA testers, product managers, UX designers to create and build new features.

Understanding and providing feedback for technical and design requirements.

Providing technical support to internal teams.

Staying abreast of and (where necessary) applying the latest emerging technologies.

Setting high standards, and continually improving how we do things




Technologies:

- API
- Cloud
- C#
- Azure



More:

Moneybox is growing rapidly, and our technical teams are no exception. We have more users, more accounts, more money invested, more features, more code, more data, and more team-members than ever before. We’re looking for a Senior Software Engineer to help us handle all that growth without compromising on our service or product quality.
This role will be part of the leadership of our Cloud Apps Team that builds and operates our cloud hosted API. We’re looking for someone who enjoys a mix of solution architecture, hands-on coding, and team leadership.  
We don’t expect you to be an expert in everything we use, but a fundamental understanding of how things work is important.


Please read before you apply!
By sending us your application you acknowledge and agree to Moneybox using your personal data as described below.
We collect applicants’ personal data to manage our recruitment related activities. Consequently, we may use your personal data to evaluate your application, to select and shortlist applicants, to set up and conduct interviews and tests, to evaluate and assess the results, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment process generally.
We do not share your personal data with unauthorised third parties. However, we may, if necessary, share your personal data to carefully selected third parties acting on our behalf. This may include transfers to servers and databases outside the country where you provided us with your personal data. Such transfers may include for example transfers and/or disclosures outside the European Economic Area and in the United States of America.
If you are unsuccessful in your application, we may keep your details on file so that we can tell you about other suitable vacancies which may be of interest to you when they arise in the future. If you would rather we did not keep your details on file, you can contact us at email: DPO@moneyboxapp.com

name: Remote Apache Airflow Specialist – ETL 🔥
title: Remote Apache Airflow Specialist – ETL 🔥
description:
Salary 70,000 - 70,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- About You:

+ Significant experience of large scale implementation using Apache Airflow
+ Be an expert in the concept of DAGs (Directed Acyclic Graph) and Operators to schedule jobs
+ Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable “big data” data stores.
+ Experience of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets.
+ Prior experience with customer data platforms.
+ Experience in performing root cause analysis on internal/external data and processes.
+ Prior experience with data analysis and data warehousing
+ Technical expertise with data models, data mining, and segmentation techniques
+ Proficiency in scripting languages (especially Python)
+ Be able to investigate current data loading procedures, planning pipelines and required steps in order to automate data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes
+ Proficiency in understanding of GitHub for source code repositories to maintain daily operation, integrity and security of source code.
+ Experience of conducting code reviews against acceptance criteria
+ Knowledge of Amazon Web Services (AWS) infrastructure & services e.g. Redshift, EC2, RDS, S3, Lambda, EMR, Batch or Athena
+ Excellent Linux scripting skills
+ Experience with data modelling, data processing and ETL
+ Passionate about the power of data to drive better business outcomes for our customers.
+ A working knowledge of SQL, query authoring and a working familiarity with a variety of relational databases.
+ Experience with Agile methodologies and change management i.e. JIRA and be able to define technical acceptance criteria for stories
+ Experience working with external partners to drive product delivery.

Personal Attributes:

+ Excellent problem-solving skills
+ Proven ability to work effectively in a distributed working environment
+ Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
+ Ability to estimate effort of own tasks and those of others in expertise domain
+ Organized, detail-oriented, and deadline-driven
+ Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work proactively, independently and as a team player
+ Ability to work efficiently and productively in a fast-paced environment
+ Willingness to learn new skills
+ Be confident with numbers




Responsibilities:

- Apache Airflow Specialist Role Summary:

Reporting to the Engineering Resource Manager in the role of Apache Airflow Specialist, you will be responsible for designing, expanding, automating and optimizing our data pipeline architecture, as well as optimising data flow and collection.

You will be responsible for the Airflow architecture to design, build and manage automated data pipelines built upon environments in AWS and pioneer ways of working that other team members can adopt

Using Apache Airflow for respondent survey pipeline building, you will work to automate components of a manual load and then add these to the pipeline. The aim is to reduce manual intervention, and increase processing speed, so that we can repeatedly process more data, at higher frequencies in the future. Where needed you may choose to add manual human tasks to the automation workflow.

You will work with Data Engineers, Python Engineers and Product Managers within Agile to deliver secure, performant and maintainable data automation. You will use best-practice continuous integration and continuous deployment methodologies to ensure that the build and deployment pipelines are fast, robust and secure. You will champion good code quality and architectural practices.




Technologies:

- Airflow
- Apache HTTP Server
- Python



More:

Who we are:

We are a provider of SaaS/software to advertising and media companies, providing the most influential agencies, media owners and planners with innovative cloud-based tools to help create, plan and predict the most successful media campaigns. With over 50 years of experience providing data and analytical tools for the marketing and advertising industry, our easy-to-use software products and solutions support over 8,000 databases, making it the industry’s most trusted third-party data analysis software globally.

name: Remote React.js Developer – Social Gaming Liv 🔥
title: Remote React.js Developer – Social Gaming Liv 🔥
description:
Salary 50,000 - 60,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- About You:

+ 3+ years experience as a React.js Developer
+ 3+ years experience in JavasScript/Typescript
+ Strong proficiency in JavaScript, including DOM manipulation and the JavaScript object model
+ Knowledge of modern authorization mechanisms, such as JSON Web Token
+ Solid experience using/consuming REST APIs
+ Experience implementing testing platforms and unit tests
+ Appreciation for clean and well documented code
+ Experience with common front-end development tools such as Babel, Webpack, NPM, etc.
+ Excellent English communication skills with the ability to contribute to architectural discussions
+ Competent with revision control systems (Git)




Responsibilities:

- The React.js Developer Role:

We are looking for a great JavaScript/Typescript developer who is proficient with React.js. Your primary focus will be on developing our WebSDK and Twitch Extension. You will be working on adding new features to the product as well as fixing any bugs.

Key Responsibilities:

+ Developing new features for our web SDK and Twitch Extension
+ Improve responsiveness and address any bugs
+ Collaborate with the team to define, design, and ship new features
+ Stay up-to-date on emerging frontend technologies




Technologies:

- React
- JavaScript
- JSON
- API



More:

What can you expect from us:

+ Working directly with some of the greatest sports brands in the world
+ Work in an exciting fast paced tech start up environment
+ Working with sports and esports!
+ You have direct access to senior team members (CEO, CTO, VPs etc)
+ A hugely passionate team who will support you all along the way
+ Working with some of the latest technology creating a new experience for the public
+ A fantastic learning experience, with long term potential from being one of the first hires in what will become a significant team and product
+ Being part of something very special as we change the way sports fans engage with content
+ At Sport Buff, you are a key person of the team and company, and you will actually own some of the company you are building (with the employee equity scheme). + Being part of this business at this stage gives you power to shape the business for the future, not just the product but the culture and team too.

What do Send:

+ Links to your GitHub, LinkedIn and StackOverflow profiles
+ Anything that reflects on your knowledge and experience in the field

Please only apply if you are based within 0-3 hours GMT.

name: .Net C# Developer – Property SaaS Platform 🔥
title: .Net C# Developer – Property SaaS Platform 🔥
description:
Salary 40,000 - 40,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Required Skills:

+ Knowledge of OOP
+ .NET C#
+ ASP.NET MVC
+ Relational databases and strong SQL skills.

Wanted:

+ Experience with Microsoft Visual Studio developing .NET desktop applications.
+ Experience developing ASP.NET web applications.
+ Experience developing and maintaining RESTful API services.
+ Team player with great communication
+ Excellent problem solving
+ Experience with Entity Framework or other ORM frameworks
+ Experience with Microsoft SQL Server
+ Experience with Microsoft Azure




Responsibilities:

- Responsibilities:

+ Take part in sprint plans with development team to outline the work ahead.
+ Carry out .NET development on new features and enhancements both for desktop and web applications.
+ Design and discuss new software products and features with the development team and stakeholders.
+ Triage and debug reported faults with software.
+ Work on a range of technologies including .NET WinForms, ASP.NET MVC, SQL Server

In addition to this the ideal candidate will be energetic and motivated with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment. You will have excellent communication skills and adopt a proactive approach to work and enjoy working as part of a team.




Technologies:

- ASP.NET
- .NET Core
- API
- MS-SQL
- Azure



More:

Since 2010 we have been transforming the management of properties for Block & Property Managers. Fast Forward 10 years and over 300,000 properties are being managed by our bespoke software solutions.

name: Full Stack Developer / Product Lead – Any Tec 🔥
title: Full Stack Developer / Product Lead – Any Tec 🔥
description:
Salary 50,000 - 75,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- About You:

+ Minimum of 5 years’ relevant work experience
+ Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent
+ An interest in product management, design and the customer experience
+ Experience of designing, implementing, and operating highly scalable web services
+ Have an innate curiosity about new technologies and aspire to combine usability with visual desirability
+ Have a deep understanding and applicable knowledge of Web & Mobile app, and SaaS software development
+ Have an extensive toolkit of skills and platform experience within your arsenal, but be comfortable & open to a variety of platforms and languages, and not wedded to a particular technology or approach
+ Have a solid track record of full stack web and web app development
+ Have experience in building platforms from the bottom up, applying rapid prototyping and iterations of MVPs with short cycle times
+ Be able to handle system administration basics
+ Be someone who will fully own the evolution of our technology stack to make pragmatic, yet bold decisions
+ Be willing and able to establish our agile processes, always with an eye to efficiency
+ Be a considerate coder with strong housekeeping / documentation habits
+ Be a strong written and verbal communicator, able to explain techie things to non-technical people
+ Be able to translate business needs into technical specifications

You’ll also have…

+ Native-level English language skills
+ All the necessary permits to work here in the UK




Responsibilities:

- What you’ll be doing / core responsibilities:

We are at an early stage of our evolution, but our ambitions are to build an integrated platform from the ground up which not only supports the operations of the business (bookings, orders etc) but also provides exceptional customer experience, and embeds the flexibility and convenience at the heart of our brand.

Ideally this platform will also provide a way to enable our customers to connect seamlessly with each other depending on their needs, to network and collaborate professionally or simply to meet new people socially.

Because we are an early-stage business, we need our tech solution to be agile and able to develop in line with our expanding and evolving business hence we are looking to build and continually develop our proprietary tech in house.

That’s where you come in…

You’ll be hands-on, taking ideas from discovery to production to build a platform that delivers delightful user experiences to our growing customer base based on our business need and feedback from customers, including: UX, Build, Testing/Q&A & Maintaining brand consistency

With a dual focus on the backend as well as the customer facing UX, you’ll take ownership for your tasks and see features through from start to finish, running the specification and build, shaping our development processes and defining our tech stack. You'll be provided with a high-level roadmap and clear business needs, but you'll have plenty of opportunity to add value throughout and put your stamp on things as you execute.

You’ll work closely / collaborating with the senior team and advisers, helping to evaluate the business and technical performance of new features.

The Full Stack Developer / Product Lead opportunity:

+ You’ll be a key member of a small but growing team
+ You’ll have plenty of responsibility, working in an output focused work environment
+ To start with you’ll be our only in-house technical team member
+ Opportunity to build a product team around you
+ You’ll be leading product development from the ground up with no legacy systems in place
+ You’ll have autonomy to design and develop cutting edge products
+ Working with very little bureaucracy or politics
+ Flexible working environment




Technologies:

- Android
- iOS
- UX UI Design



More:

About us:

We are the next generation solution to local, flexible working. Our vision is to become the go to 'next generation' workspace located on local high streets across the UK.

Conveniently located on high streets in residential areas (South West London currently) we provide a flexible, convenient workspace and community for people who live locally, limiting the need to commute and travel into offices.

We’re a funded, fast-growing workspace and café combining all the services and functionality of an office with the flexibility demanded by the ‘new normal’ way of working.

Our mission today:

+ Open 4 more sites across South West London in the next 12-18 months.
+ Create a customer-centric business with cross functional activity.
+ Own and operate a tech platform to streamline the customer experience.
+ Build a team of self-starting, enthusiastic individuals looking to work and grow in a scalable start-up in an exciting new industry.

What’s important to us:

+ Providing exceptional customer experience.
+ Remaining dynamic and flexible.
+ Engaging with local high street communities and working with other local businesses.
+ Working closely with our partners in the speciality coffee and tea industry to support them and their farmers.
+ Creating a welcoming and friendly community at all of our locations for both our customers and our team.

name: WordPress Developer – Remote – £30-45K 🔥
title: WordPress Developer – Remote – £30-45K 🔥
description:
Salary 30,000 - 45,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Responsibilities:

+ Working with an existing WordPress team, managing tasks, schedules, and deliverables.
+ Find technical solutions to solve WordPress & WooCommerce problems
+ Liaise with customers to ensure their WordPress websites are performing as best as they can be
+ Manage and delegate WordPress support tickets
+ Communicate effectively with senior management, developers and partners.
+ Manage the development, release, and maintenance of WordPress/WooCommerce projects
+ Track and report the status of projects to Senior Management.
+ Drive innovation for the core business operations by recommending viable technologies.
+ Anticipate issues, identify future choke points, and work ahead of time to alleviate potential issues.

Skills Required:

+ 3+ years Experience in WordPress & WooCommerce
+ Ability to build WordPress plugins
+ Strong knowledge in PHP, MYSQL,Nodejs, Javascript, JQuery, CSS, HTML, AJAX, My SQL.
+ Lots of experience working with WooCommerce and WooCommerce plugins
+ Testing and Debugging/UI Testing
+ Experience with version control such as BitBucket or GitHub
+ Solid understanding of object-orientated principles.
+ Ability to run a team of devs and manage day to day running of multiple projects.
+ Strong communication skills as it will require client interaction




Responsibilities:

- The Role:

Our successful candidate will be self-motivated and highly organised, rallying the troops for a successful project outcome. The roleholder will be highly effective in their communications, with attention to detail. They’re not afraid of tackling the hard issues, and love it when a plan comes together! They’ll deliver results that exceed expectations.




Technologies:

- WordPress
- PHP
- MySQL
- CSS
- jQuery



More:

What we can offer:

We promote an open, positive working environment, with a professional yet easy-going atmosphere.

As a growing agency you will have a real opportunity to help shape our future, and the role is only limited by your imagination and business acumen.

+ 25 days holiday (plus bank holidays and 1 extras for birthday)
+ Pension plan, including company contributions
+ Leaders value each employee, and are committed to the team’s growth and success
+ Regular training and development opportunities
+ Regular social activities based around significant company achievements.
+ Relaxed working environment
+ Flexible working hours (we don’t believe in 9-5!)
+ Coffee machine, tea, mineral water and fresh fruit
+ Table Football, Xbox, VR and chill out areas to unwind

Who are we?

We develop web and mobile apps for brands, startups and established businesses looking to take their online presence to the next level. We have just moved into beautiful new offices in Grazeley, just outside Reading (M4 Junction 11) where we have undergone a modern refit including Table football, VR, and chillout areas in a lovely rural location.

If you’re a passionate and engaging and driven individual this is an excellent opportunity to be part of the beating heart of the onsite team and make a real mark within the business as we grow.
desc:
Salary 30,000 - 45,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Responsibilities:

+ Working with an existing WordPress team, managing tasks, schedules, and deliverables.
+ Find technical solutions to solve WordPress & WooCommerce problems
+ Liaise with customers to ensure their WordPress websites are performing as best as they can be
+ Manage and delegate WordPress support tickets
+ Communicate effectively with senior management, developers and partners.
+ Manage the development, release, and maintenance of WordPress/WooCommerce projects
+ Track and report the status of projects to Senior Management.
+ Drive innovation for the core business operations by recommending viable technologies.
+ Anticipate issues, identify future choke points, and work ahead of time to alleviate potential issues.

Skills Required:

+ 3+ years Experience in WordPress & WooCommerce
+ Ability to build WordPress plugins
