We were recently featured in WIRED’s 100 Hottest Startups as well as featured in Europe’s Disruption50 Index. Vidsy has offices in London and New York and is growing rapidly.

Role
We’re looking for a backend engineer to help us to build and scale the services that power our products. This is a chance to have a real impact and make a difference to the way we code, our culture and the products that are built at Vidsy.

name: Lead Software Engineer 🔥
title: Lead Software Engineer 🔥
description:
Salary 90,000 - 120,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Experience in development in one of the following languages: Python, Golang, Node.js
Object Oriented Programming and SOLID principles.
A testing first mind-set: TDD/BDD
Cloud Technology awareness and Serverless Architecture
Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery and experience of Agile working environments




Responsibilities:

- As an ECS Lead Developer, you’ll be integral to our client facing delivery teams, working with clients to design and build their technology enabled cloud Contact Centre solution.

About the role:

Responsible for providing technical thought leadership on client engagements.
Providing technical thought leadership on client engagements as well as helping build out the practice engineering function to enable the organisation to scale.
Hands on in projects, taking a lead in the design and development of solutions as well as providing technical guidance and validation to the wider team.
Actively contributing to development team activities and solutions
Proactively provide recommendations and thought into existing ways of working to ensure optimum efficiency and continuous improvement
Responsible for stakeholder management, building client relationships and identifying new opportunities.
You will need to have a thirst to grow and mentor those that you work with. People come first and it's important to foster the long term progression of the team.




Technologies:

- Python
- AWS
- API



More:

ECS are one of the leading and fastest growing Digital Transformation Consultancies in the UK, specialising in Cloud Enablement, Data & Analytics, Cost Optimisation, DevOps and Customer Experience. Working with an enviable client base of Enterprise level organisations, our work enables companies to be fit for purpose in the 21st century.

Our values define the way we do business. We’re obsessive about delivering business value through technology and operate with a strong, continuous customer focus. We prioritise integrity in all that we do – providing a transparent support structure to help our people develop skills to progress their career.

As leaders in Digital Transformation we’re adaptable and quick to embrace change and new technologies. We believe in hiring people passionate about delivering cutting-edge modern software and platforms. Our biggest asset is our people! People who don’t settle for second best and people who work and win in teams to deliver the best solutions. Everyone at ECS is encouraged to do things differently, to believe in themselves and each other, and to make daring decisions – even if it means making the occasional mistake.

You’ll be working on a variety of industry leading projects, often with organisations that have their own challenges, so you’ll need to be able to adapt seamlessly to different ways of working and quickly build relationships to create a collaborative approach with your team and stakeholders.
We offer a great benefits package and opportunity to get exposure to unique, cutting edge projects with a team of like-minded individuals all striving for the same goals. The nature of our work is consulting, so whilst we’ll look to have you based from your local office/region (London, Edinburgh, Manchester, Glasgow, Pune), there will be an element of travel involved in meet clients and embedding solutions.

Why ECS?
ECS consultants benefit from a comprehensive health and wellness plans including private healthcare (clinical & mental), discounted gym memberships, in office yoga sessions & massages.
Our inclusive, positive culture is at the heart of everything we do. We focus on genuine continuous development with a generous training budget. We have pods for collaboration and breakout areas for when you need to be in the zone. If you find yourself enjoying the pick and mix, playing pool, table tennis or PlayStation, coming out to one of the many team outings, and company paid Friday Lunch, please don’t worry. These things are here for you to actually enjoy.

That said, we continue to invest heavily in providing our staff with time to develop. We understand how vital it is to allow you to commit to areas relevant to your career. We certify all of our engineers with each of our vendors and are committed to staying at the forefront of the frequent changes in our rapidly evolving digital landscape.

name: Test Engineer 🔥
title: Test Engineer 🔥
description:
Salary 40,000 - 65,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Good knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools and processes
A keen eye for detail and enthusiasm for quality
Experience in writing clear, concise and comprehensive test plans and test cases
Hands-on experience implementing automated test suites, that validate software conformance to defined acceptance criteria, design documentation and application standards
Ability to understand both product and engineering domains, and apply QA best practices to both
18 months (plus) experience in writing and running automated test suites using TypeScript/JavaScript, Go, Python or similar




Responsibilities:

- Working in an autonomous, multi-functional team of developers, QA engineers, designers and product owners
Performing automated and manual testing of the Vidsy platforms
Adding to the existing mature automated browser test framework, as well as contributing to accessibility, load, security and contract testing
Being an advocate for quality, encouraging developers at all levels to write higher quality, testable software




Technologies:

- TypeScript
- JavaScript
- Terraform



More:

About Vidsy
We are a creative tech start-up disrupting the creative advertising industry by reinventing the way brands and creators unite to create effective video advertising content. This is all managed through our bespoke platform which is built in-house by our growing cross-functional engineering team.

We were recently featured in WIRED’s 100 Hottest Startups as well as featured in Europe’s Disruption50 Index. Vidsy has offices in London and New York and is growing rapidly.

The Role
We’re looking for a proactive, technically-minded and organised test engineer to join the Vidsy product and engineering team. You will work very closely with all of the other roles in the team, helping at all stages of the product development lifecycle. We are looking for someone who can work autonomously and help to build upon our existing mature testing framework. The role is a mixture of automated and manual testing, as well as covering many different areas of testing (browser, accessibility, load, security and contract). This is a chance to have a real impact, where your contributions make a difference and you will have a say in the way code, culture and product are built at Vidsy.

name: Python Developer 🔥
title: Python Developer 🔥
location: The Westworks Building, 195 Wood Lane , London

Requirements:

- Python language is ESSENTIAL
Experience using JavaScript
Extremely confident in Sql, AWS and Mongo
Experience with Git or other version control systems

- JavaScript



More:

Our London HQ is based in White City Place where our team is made up individuals who are knowledgeable, professional and passionate about what PLG do. Join us on our mission and we will challenge, stretch and support you to achieve more than you can possibly imagine throughout your career.

name: Senior Software Engineer - Semantics 🔥
title: Senior Software Engineer - Semantics 🔥
description:
Salary 50,000 - 75,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- t least 5 years of experience in software development.

Have practical experience with developing and maintaining distributed systems.
Experience with Scala and Python, or deep knowledge of one of the above with desire to learn the other.
Experience with asynchronous network I/O.
Experience with Kafka, Spark.




Responsibilities:

- What you’ll be doing:

Developing, designing and maintaining a reliable, distributed, scalable web page analysis solution
Integrating that solution with our data partners via various API endpoints
Working closely with ML engineers to improve and facilitate the deployment of ML models
Working with cutting edge technologies in a fast-paced, start-up like environment
Setting up monitoring for performance metrics and overall system behaviour to have alerts for any anomaly detected
Ensuring the quality of the product you deliver as a part of the team
Experimenting with new tools and technologies, producing POC to address business needs
Be a part of self-organizing, result-oriented agile team




Technologies:

- API
- HTTP
- Kafka
- Network
- Python
- Scala
- Spark
- Web



More:



OVERVIEW
We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer working as a part of the team responsible for development of the contextual product that is used to derive meaning from web pages and link that meaning to search data.
Search on its own is a highly complex data-set. Captify’s technologies have been built to extract maximum value from search for brands, partners and businesses all over the world and also to innovate & improve the consumer experience.
Captify’s world-class engineers, semantic specialists and product teams are building the future of Search and as part of our Engineering Team you will play a key part in developing our offering.
 We work in small cross-functional pods of developers who focus on a particular product area and we encourage people to rotate across teams. 
Our engineering guide will give you a good feel for how we work together. Our company values are important to us and influence how we work together.
With exciting projects, technologies and services in the pipeline now is a great time to be part of our journey.
 
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
What you’ll be doing:

Developing, designing and maintaining a reliable, distributed, scalable web page analysis solution
Integrating that solution with our data partners via various API endpoints

Working closely with ML engineers to improve and facilitate the deployment of ML models
Working with cutting edge technologies in a fast-paced, start-up like environment
Setting up monitoring for performance metrics and overall system behaviour to have alerts for any anomaly detected
Ensuring the quality of the product you deliver as a part of the team
Experimenting with new tools and technologies, producing POC to address business needs
Be a part of self-organizing, result-oriented agile team
 
REQUIREMENTS:
What you need to be successful:
At least 5 years of experience in software development.

Have practical experience with developing and maintaining distributed systems.
Experience with Scala and Python, or deep knowledge of one of the above with desire to learn the other.
Experience with asynchronous network I/O.
Experience with Kafka, Spark.
Proactive self-starter who takes ownership and is able to drive the project and mentor team members, good team player.
B.Sc. in Computer Science or related field;
Excellent communication skills and ability to work directly with English native speakers.
 
CAPTIFY EXPLAINED 
Captify is the largest holder of consumer search data outside of Google, and its unique technology understands the intent of consumers across all channels, including voice Search, desktop on-site search and in-app search. Captify’s privacy centric Search Intelligence technology powers programmatic advertising and unique audience insights for the world’s biggest brands, such as Apple, Disney, Adidas, American Express and Microsoft.
 
OUR CULTURE AND VALUES:
Here at Captify we are proud of our culture - It’s contagious. Pass it on. 
Step inside any of our global offices and one thing that is blissfully obvious is that while we’re putting blood, sweat and tears into disrupting the Search game, we’re having a seriously good time doing it. We’ve travelled the world together, enjoyed Captify Festivals, parties and our famous events across every market. We always take time to stop to celebrate milestones and wins.
We champion diversity and inclusion. Our ‘BeTheChange’ programme and internal D&I Taskforce brings our teams together to challenge, learn and build a more equal Captify.
We live by our core values;. 

Building this together
Gives a shit
Fail fast to succeed faster
Unlimited potential 
Find out more about our culture here: https://careers.captify.co.uk/
YOU WILL ENJOY

Enjoy our flexible/core hours and home working as per company policy
Work from any Captify office in the world - giving every employee the opportunity to experience life at Captify in another city
A pet friendly office based in Covent Garden, London’s Media Hub!
Time off to recharge - 25 days holidays + bank holidays + your birthday 
Giving something back to the community - Give A Day Away for volunteering
We care about Wellbeing - from financial wellbeing, mental health first aiders, yoga, sports, meditation and so much more
Parent friendly policies
The normal stuff; Pension, Cycle Scheme, Eyecare Vouchers and retail discounts
Beer, bubbles and non-alcoholic alternatives every Thursday and Friday at the Captify Bar
Legendary Summer and Christmas parties


EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES
You are welcome at Captify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what your search history says about you. At Captify, equality is at the core of our culture and we are committed to building an inclusive global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences. The more diverse we are, the richer our community and the broader our impact.  We don’t want you to fit in with our culture, we want you to add to our culture.
For candidates, view our EU HR Candidate Privacy Notice here.

name: Senior Software Engineer - Data/Backend 🔥
title: Senior Software Engineer - Data/Backend 🔥
description:
Salary 75,000 - 90,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- What you need to be successful:

At least 5 years of experience in software development.
Have practical experience with developing products with a focus on analytical data processing and querying
Strong expertise in ElasticSearch or similar semi-structured data stores
Experience with Python and Node.js, or deep knowledge of one of the above with desire to learn the other.




Responsibilities:

- What you’ll be doing:

Working closely with full stack and ML engineers to improve and build out our Sense product

Ensuring the quality of the product you deliver as a part of the team
Experimenting with new tools and technologies, producing PoC to address business needs

- Python
- NodeJS

Search  on its own is a highly complex data-set. Captify’s technologies have been built to extract maximum value from search for brands, partners and businesses all over the world and also to innovate & improve the consumer experience.

Working closely with full stack and ML engineers to improve and build out our Sense product
Working with cutting edge technologies in a fast-paced, start-up like environment

Ensuring the quality of the product you deliver as a part of the team
Experimenting with new tools and technologies, producing PoC to address business needs
Be a part of self-organizing, result-oriented agile team
 
 REQUIREMENTS:
What you need to be successful:

At least 5 years of experience in software development.
Have practical experience with developing products with a focus on analytical data processing and querying
Strong expertise in ElasticSearch or similar semi-structured data stores
Experience with Python and Node.js, or deep knowledge of one of the above with desire to learn the other. 
Proactive self-starter who takes ownership and is able to drive the project and mentor team members, good team player.
B.Sc. in Computer Science or related field;
Excellent communication skills in English
 
CAPTIFY EXPLAINED 
Captify is the largest holder of consumer search data outside of Google, and its unique technology understands the intent of consumers across all channels, including voice Search, desktop on-site search and in-app search. Captify’s privacy centric Search Intelligence technology powers programmatic advertising and unique audience insights for the world’s biggest brands, such as Apple, Disney, Adidas, American Express and Microsoft.
OUR CULTURE AND VALUES:
Here at Captify we are proud of our culture - It’s contagious. Pass it on. 
Step inside any of our global offices and one thing that is blissfully obvious is that while we’re putting blood, sweat and tears into disrupting the Search game, we’re having a seriously good time doing it. We’ve travelled the world together, enjoyed Captify Festivals, parties and our famous events across every market. We always take time to stop to celebrate milestones and wins.
We champion diversity and inclusion. Our 'BeTheChange' programme and internal D&I Taskforce brings our teams together to challenge, learn and build a more equal Captify. 
We live by our core values;. 

Building this together
Gives a shit
Fail fast to succeed faster
Unlimited potential 
Find out more about our culture here: https://careers.captify.co.uk/


YOU WILL ENJOY

Enjoy our flexible/core hours and home working as per company policy
Work from any Captify office in the world - giving every employee the opportunity to experience life at Captify in another city
A pet friendly office based in Covent Garden, London’s Media Hub!
Time off to recharge - 25 days holidays + bank holidays + your birthday 
Giving something back to the community - Give A Day Away for volunteering
We care about Wellbeing - from financial wellbeing, mental health first aiders, yoga, sports, meditation and so much more
Parent friendly policies
The normal stuff; Pension, Cycle Scheme, Eyecare Vouchers and retail discounts
Beer, bubbles and non-alcoholic alternatives every Thursday and Friday at the Captify Bar
Legendary Summer and Christmas parties
 
EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES
You are welcome at Captify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what your search history says about you. At Captify, equality is at the core of our culture and we are committed to building an inclusive global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences. The more diverse we are, the richer our community and the broader our impact.  We don’t want you to fit in with our culture, we want you to add to our culture.
For candidates, view our EU HR Candidate Privacy Notice here.

OVERVIEW
We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer working as a part of the team responsible for providing a full-stack self-service solution to clients and partners for planning, activation, measurement, and insights, tapping into the best of Captify’s proprietary data and analysis.

Search  on its own is a highly complex data-set. Captify’s technologies have been built to extract maximum value from search for brands, partners and businesses all over the world and also to innovate & improve the consumer experience.
Captify’s world-class engineers, semantic specialists and product teams are building the future of Search and as part of our Engineering Team you will play a key part in developing our offering.
 
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
What you’ll be doing:

Developing, designing and maintaining a reliable, scalable data-driven SaaS product
Working in a cross-functional team to deliver product features
Working closely with full stack and ML engineers to improve and build out our Sense product
Working with cutting edge technologies in a fast-paced, start-up like environment

Ensuring the quality of the product you deliver as a part of the team
Experimenting with new tools and technologies, producing PoC to address business needs
Be a part of self-organizing, result-oriented agile team

name: Full Stack Developer 🔥
title: Full Stack Developer 🔥
description:
Salary 45,000 - 55,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- •
Minimum 5 years experience in PHP development, preferably same with current Laravel framework
•
Minimum 5 years experience in JS development, preferably 3 years experience with Vue.js
•
Minimum 3 years experience working with SQL (MySQL, SQLite, MS-SQL
•
Knowledge of Progressive Web Apps / SPAs
•
Test driven development
•
Team player but with the ability to take responsibility for complex programs and their outcomes
•
Willingness to take the initiative when required
•
Ability to work under pressure and to timescales and yet retain a sense of fun
•
Driven, enthusiastic and ambitious
•
Good analytical and problem solving skills




Responsibilities:

- •
Work with the team to define, scope and plan product development
•
Translate client requirements into creative solutions and accurate software specifications
•
Develop robust and functionally excellent applications and software solutions using a range of technologies.
•
Contribute to the UI/UX development for our clients that accelerate their learning and development.




Technologies:

- Laravel
- PHP
- SQL
- Vue
- Jenkins
- GitHub
- AWS



More:

ACHiiVE is the leading Learning & Development consultancy within the Pharmaceutical industry. Based in Winchester, our clients include the majority of the top 50 Global Big Pharma companies. We provide integrated Learning solutions that tie together highly innovative simulation based training events, tailored workshops and a growing portfolio of virtualised digital learning platforms to support modern, personalised learning & Development journeys.

We are a small, friendly yet ambitious consultancy who use innovation as a differentiator to deliver high value solutions to our clients globally.

We are looking for an experienced full stack developer to join the team and support the increased demand for innovative new digital products and SaaS developments . Development experience required is primarily back end but should include front end UI/UX expertise.
At ACHiiVE you will certainly have the freedom to drive innovation and creativity.

name: Microsoft 365  Business Consultant 🔥
title: Microsoft 365  Business Consultant 🔥
description:
Salary 45,000 - 55,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- → Analytical – an aptitude for maths, science and technology
→ Approachable – you’re friendly, engaging, confident and outgoing
→ Passionate about Technology – you’re continually learning about technology,
developing yourself and enjoy sharing your knowledge
→ Clear Communicator – you write succinctly and use appropriate language for the
situation
→ Technology – experienced in using SharePoint Online + Microsoft Teams




Responsibilities:

- → Helping our clients manage their information through intranets, document management and collaboration solutions using SharePoint, Microsoft Teams and the Power Platform
→ Improve their processes through information management related applications using Power Apps and Power Automate
→ Take the pain away for our clients when moving Microsoft cloud by designing how Microsoft 365 can work best to support their business
→ Support technology adoption through training and awareness sessions to power-users and end users
→ Provide ongoing support to our clients via our Success Service




Technologies:

- SharePoint
- MS Teams



More:

We’re a small and growing business, there are 3 of us so far, this gives you the
opportunity to work on a variety of tasks and learn from experienced Microsoft 365
veterans!


We have great office space in Fetcham, near Leatherhead – where you will be with the team around 2 to 3 times a week.
Outdoors there are gardens & fountains, and seating areas.
Indoors we have showers, proper coffee and free parking, at close to the surrey hills if you like to get out!

We work from 9am to 5.30pm. We start with a team daily stand-up at 9am and a review of the day at 5pm.

In the rare case we ask you to work on a weekend – we will give you an extra day of holiday in lieu

We are a consultancy – so please do expect to travel to our clients' offices

name: Head of Developer Relations 🔥
title: Head of Developer Relations 🔥
description:
Salary 100,000 - 130,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Ingenio has an exclusive opportunity for a senior Developer Relations professional to join a high-growth, VC-backed, SaaS startup at the most exciting time in its journey to date.

- We are looking for an empathetic, credible and value-driven Developer Relations professional
- You must have experience in a DevRel / Developer Advocate / Developer Evangelist or alternative role in a SaaS company
- Crucially, you have working knowledge of APIs & open-source software
- You understand Developer communities, come up with creative strategies to engage them and will use this solution as a way to solve their pain points
- Create content and reach Developers across a wide range of communities (e.g. Hacker News, Stack Overflow, Reddit)




Responsibilities:

- As the first DevRel hire in the company, this is an opportunity to truly make an impact in the business and bring value to the Developer Community, which the team is so passionate about.

You'll work very closely with the Product, Engineering, Sales, Marketing and Customer Success teams

As an early employee, there will be endless career opportunities for you




Technologies:

- API
- Java
- JavaScript



More:

- Company built by Developers, for Developers
- Four authentic Co-Founders who have previous history working together
- Impressive Board and proven Executive team that is attracting top talent across every part of the business
- In 2020, they achieved 170% growth and their customers tripled... this was with barely any Sales or Marketing
- Their technology is phenomenal and highly regarded within the Community; a market-leading API product displacing legacy players
- Customer-centric approach with global referenceable customers from SMB to Enterprise
- Clear and ambitious growth and product plans
- The people in the business are incredible and this has created a truly special culture, where everyone is passionate about what they do, supportive and winning together!
- The salary is flexible as this position will be moulded around the individual that joins
- This can also be an entirely remote position in EMEA or North America

name: Senior React Developer 🔥
title: Senior React Developer 🔥
description:
Salary 70,000 - 100,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- You must love technology and be able to programme proficiently
You must be an expert learner and be able to grok unfamiliar technologies fast
Feel uncomfortable when contributions are below-par and actively promote techniques and ideas to improve our technical output
Be able to communicate complex topics to a layperson clearly and concisely
You must appreciate the joy of using good, elegant software




Responsibilities:

- As a Senior React Developer, you will lead, coach and mentor other developers. You will still be hands on technically and will have the opportunity to develop frontend components as part of our fortnightly sprints. Some areas of focus include: designing and enabling a simple UX through a powerful UI using TypeScript and React; researching and developing new types of visualisations for connected data; supporting new sources of data loading; and enhancing the visualisation and navigation of data with support for very high volumes of data.




Technologies:

- ASP.NET
- Backend
- C
- C#
- CAN
- Frontend
- JavaScript
- React
- TypeScript
- Webpack
- Web
- UX UI Design



More:

Solidatus Job Description

Senior React Developer

Permanent / Competitive Salary, experience-dependent / City of London (temporarily remote due to Covid-19)

About Solidatus

Solidatus is a fast-growing software and technology company based in the City of London. Having launched the software in 2017, after years of incubation and testing, Solidatus has solidified its place as one of the most influential and critical new software solutions positioned to help the world’s largest data-rich and regulated organisations manage their processes and data.

Solidatus is a multipurpose modelling, visualisation and traceability tool. It is used to model connected things in a generic and elegant way. We have developed a powerful backend which can model temporal graph structures with branching and version control to enable complex and maintainable collaboration workflows. This is exposed for technical and non-technical users through the web-based frontend where user experience takes a front row seat alongside scalability.

This is an incredibly exciting time to join Solidatus. In 2020 alone, we announced our strategic investment from Citi, entered Gartner’s prestigious Magic Quadrant and were awarded ‘Best Data Governance Solution’ by the A-Team. We were also recognised by FinTech Global’s RegTech100, chosen to support the FCA’s Digital Sandbox Pilot and maintained an ‘100% would recommend’ rating on Gartner Peer Insights. Our team has more than tripled in size since the start of the year, collectively supporting in these achievements. 2021 will see us expand into new territories and sectors, continuing at the same rate of growth, and further disrupting the market with our unique, lineage-first solution ... and we’re just getting started!

About the Team
We work with and learn from first-class engineers with outstanding computer science backgrounds, designing smart solutions to difficult visualisation problems to delight our users. We are a tight-knit team working to directly support some of the largest organisations in the world, taking pleasure in crafting elegant code with the freedom to explore new technologies.

We enjoy what we do!

Role
We are looking for first-class programmers who understand the importance of code elegance, who are deeply engaged by computer science and who are interested in many technologies. Our clients are impressive and the work you do will have a direct and significant impact on our users’ experience with Solidatus and ultimately on our success. You will be interviewed by an engineer with no BS questions. Don’t be surprised if during your interview all you do is chat about tech. We interview quickly and honestly and are able to offer positions for immediate start.

What we’re looking for
Solidatus is being scaled up all around the world, employing people who share our vision. We’re looking for people who align with our core values: Strength in Teamwork, Attention to the Customer and to Detail. The kind of person who wants to join a community of ambitious and kind people, all personally and professionally invested in Solidatus’ mission.

What you’ll be doing
As a Senior React Developer, you will lead, coach and mentor other developers. You will still be hands on technically and will have the opportunity to develop frontend components as part of our fortnightly sprints. Some areas of focus include: designing and enabling a simple UX through a powerful UI using TypeScript and React; researching and developing new types of visualisations for connected data; supporting new sources of data loading; and enhancing the visualisation and navigation of data with support for very high volumes of data.

Other things that keep us busy include researching and developing new solutions to existing problems faced by current users and the wider data connectivity community; communicating with users to provide support or diagnosis where a support ticket has been escalated to engineering; maintaining and improving the development workflow; and contributing to continuous improvement.

What you’ll need
There are a bunch of languages, frameworks and platforms that we use today but we are not duty-bound to any particular technology. We are engineers and are encouraged to use the best tool for the job. More than anything in the list below, we care about your attitude, your personability and your relationship with technology.

You must love technology and be able to programme proficiently
You must be an expert learner and be able to grok unfamiliar technologies fast
Feel uncomfortable when contributions are below-par and actively promote techniques and ideas to improve our technical output
Be able to communicate complex topics to a layperson clearly and concisely
You must appreciate the joy of using good, elegant software

Experience and qualifications
Have an in-depth knowledge of JavaScript and the associated frontend technologies: React, NPM, Webpack, babel, TypeScript (but know when to be an early-adopter and when to wait for fads to establish)
A UX-focused mindset is essential
Experience leading, coaching or mentoring other developers is highly desirable
You must have a long history using software and be able to critique user interfaces
Experience with C#, ASP.NET Core or similar is beneficial

Remuneration & Benefits
24 days holiday + Bank Holidays
Your Birthday off on us (or within your birthday week)
Access to our EMI options scheme – once per year valuation/enrolment – backdated to start date
Competitive salary, experience-dependent
All the latest tech you need
Private healthcare for you and all your dependants
Pension plan
Skip the commute and work remotely as you need
Cycle to work scheme
Eye care with top City optician

name: Lead DevOps Engineer 🔥
title: Lead DevOps Engineer 🔥
description:
Salary 70,000 - 100,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- - You'll have the necessary skills to run our software in Azure (“solution architect” or equivalent), as well as with networking and Cisco tools (CCNA is a nice-to-have).
- You'll know your Linux, MacOS and Windows very well, and are fluent in Bash and Python. You’ll have some experience with C/make and have used Maven before to build a Java application or two. You’re also comfortable working with MySQL, RabbitMQ and Redis.
- Your CI/CD skills are great, and you know all the common tools used such as Docker, Gitlab, Puppet, Terraform, TeamCity, Octopus, Nginx (etc). You also know your way around monitoring tools like Zabbix and the ELK stack.
- As a person you are process driven, solution-oriented, a good communicator and with a curious personality and your sleeves permanently rolled-up. We get stuff done, and we lead by example.
- You probably have 8 or more years professional DevOps experience.




Responsibilities:

- As Glisser’s Lead DevOps Engineer you are responsible for managing and building our software infrastructure. This is a core function and role within the business, and you are expected to lead, increase productivity, performance and drive overall excellence.

In this role you will:

- Work as an integrated part of the software engineering organisation, understanding the application architecture.
- Orchestrate the provisioning, load balancing, dynamic configuration, monitoring, and spend optimisation of servers across cloud providers, data centers and availability zones.
- Manage development of internal engineering productivity tools and be responsible for development and operation of continuous integration and deployment pipeline.
- Coordinate with the Talent team and department Heads to ensure new starters are set-up with the appropriate hardware, software and permissions to conduct their roles effectively and securely (“SysAdmin”).

Glisser operates a hybrid platform infrastructure setup, with both On Prem (in London) and Azure as core parts.




Technologies:

- Azure
- Cisco
- Bash
- Python
- C
- Maven
- Java
- MySQL
- RabbitMQ
- Redis
- Docker
- GitLab
- Puppet
- Terraform
- Teamcity
- Nginx
- ELK



More:

Glisser is the trusted platform for the virtual events world of today and the hybrid events world of tomorrow.

We’re growing Glisser to be the leading enterprise platform in this space, giving our clients best-in-class tools to create outstanding virtual and hybrid events that their audiences love. Glisser brings people together, creating interactive and engaging experiences for anything from 50 to 50,000 attendees.

We care about security, scalability and simplicity. Our platform is highly customizable, generates powerful data analytics and offers monetization solutions for those event organizers responding to our newly virtualized environment.

We are headquartered in London, UK, with a strong presence and growth-focus in the US.

We are currently fully remote, with a view to moving to a hybrid model when appropriate. We expect to meet physically at key times in the year, focused on making these sessions a highly effective use of everyone’s time. Day-to-day, we intend to remain largely virtual, meaning this opportunity is open to applicants anywhere in the United Kingdom.

name: Senior Interaction Designer  🔥
title: Senior Interaction Designer  🔥
description:
Salary 50,000 - 65,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- • Have an understanding of interaction and user interface design
• Have industry or government experience in designing elegant, accessible, responsive user interfaces
• Be confident in designing at low and high fidelity, for different screen sizes
• Have a range of experience prototyping interactions
• Have an ability to talk about, and advocate for, user-centred design in a way that other people understand
• Understand the importance of working with research and business analysis to inform design decisions
• Have the ability to lead the design direction and voice user centred design in communities of practice
• Have experience of working collaboratively in a dynamic agile environment and using agile tools
• Have experience in removing complexity from services and solving problems
• Can identify and understand constraints and can communicate these and work within them
• Are able to manage stakeholder expectations and facilitate difficult discussions with a wide range of stakeholders




Responsibilities:

- • Have an understanding of interaction and user interface design
• Have industry or government experience in designing elegant, accessible, responsive user interfaces
• Be confident in designing at low and high fidelity, for different screen sizes
• Have a range of experience prototyping interactions
• Have an ability to talk about, and advocate for, user-centred design in a way that other people understand
• Understand the importance of working with research and business analysis to inform design decisions
• Have the ability to lead the design direction and voice user centred design in communities of practice
• Have experience of working collaboratively in a dynamic agile environment and using agile tools
• Have experience in removing complexity from services and solving problems
• Can identify and understand constraints and can communicate these and work within them
• Are able to manage stakeholder expectations and facilitate difficult discussions with a wide range of stakeholders




Technologies:

-



More:

It’s an exciting time to be joining DfE Digital and Technology. We’re transforming how the government makes policy and services for young people, teachers, adult learners and the social care system!

We’re looking for a Senior Interaction Designer to help set direction and embed good practice within teams and who is committed to using design to deliver a better experience and better outcomes for users of government services.

DfE’s Digital and Technology team is constantly growing and a key 2021 priority is to respond to the needs of children and students.

We work in multidisciplinary teams that deliver outcomes for children and families, schools and teachers. There are also teams that deliver internal DfE products that help us deliver better, more joined up services. We’re dedicated to making a difference to these groups by building user-centred digital services.

name: Risk IT Production Support Engineer  🔥
title: Risk IT Production Support Engineer  🔥
description:
Salary 60,000 - 70,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Educated to professional or Bachelor’s degree level or equivalent qualification/relevant work, a focus in a technical subject would be beneficial

Basic knowledge of application development lifecycle

Experience with trading or risk management applications a plus

Familiarity with production management i.e. capacity management, incident management, change management and knowledge of business fundamentals of Debt products, Risk management

Ability to work autonomously and make decision; excellent analytical skills




Responsibilities:

- Act as a Production Support engineer in the Global Risk IT production team, providing first and second level support to the Trading, Business Finance and Market Risk teams for the suite of applications and their associated components

Act as the prime liaison for the application suite into the incident, problem, change, release, capacity, and continuity functions

Management and communication of major production incidents

Liaising with development teams on new application handover and 3rd line escalation of issues

Application rollout activities (may include some weekend activities)




Technologies:

- Android
- Bluetooth
- Data-Science



More:

As the Production Support engineer, you will work with the Global Rates and Credit - Risk IT support team, providing front line support to the trading and business finance teams and also to the various risk and regulatory systems used by multiple businesses including Global Rates, Credit , Emerging Markets etc.

The team you will join is responsible for management of EMLs risk management systems in Rates and Credit businesses. You will have the opportunity to develop professionally —and to grow your career in any direction you choose.

Our values define the working environment we strive to create - diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential.
We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation.

name: Senior Software Engineer 🔥
title: Senior Software Engineer 🔥
description:
Salary 45,000 - 65,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- •
In-depth knowledge of Python is essential.
•
Strong experience in OOP, both design and implementation
•
Frameworks such as Django
•
API development using RESTFul principles
•
3+ years of software development experience at a high level
•
Experience of testing software as part of the development cycle




Responsibilities:

- •
Participate in the full lifecycle of software development
•
Writing well designed, testable and efficient code
•
Working closely with colleagues in a cross-functional engineering and product team to develop analytical software
•
Documenting and maintaining software functionality
•
Champion the development of software development best practice within the team and mentor more junior members of the team
•
Continuous professional development
•
An enthusiastic disseminator of their knowledge to their peers




Technologies:

- Python
- Django
- API
- Fullstack



More:

Aigenpulse is a 5-year-old start-up working within the Life Sciences and backed by a network of influential super angels. We are building a next-generation data platform for importing, integrating, processing, linking, visualizing, exploring, and analysing biological data across multiple sources/types into a common frame of reference. Thus, enabling clients to safely leverage all their data assets to create new deep insights, build predictive foresight and share findings with stakeholders.

We are looking for passionate and motivated team players to join our team. We are looking for individuals who want to deliver great code and solutions that will help solve pressing problems in the life sciences. We are looking for individuals who are happy to work within a diverse team of professionals and combine your skills and experience with their knowledge to bring great solutions for our customers.

Our team is truly international with staff working remotely in England, Greece, and Germany. The local teams generally meet up face to face on a regular basis and we are looking froward to be able to host company retreats as soon as it is safe to do so. We are a family first company and we promote flexible working. We actively encourage home working and promote a positive family environment for both your family and our work family.

The kind of people we are looking for:

•
Foster a culture that values critical thinking and problem solving, and encourage constructive collaborative feedback, friendly engagement, inclusion and diversity at all levels of the business; this forms the basis of our core values: Trust, Respect and Diversity
•
Keen to learn about new technologies and share this knowledge with the team, presenting them as solutions when they are appropriate.
•
People who are willing to learn from and teach the people around them.

At Aigenpulse we value our developers as people as well as employees. We want you to grow and learn here and so we would be delighted to support you to attend courses, conferences or anything else that would benefit you or your team. We also offer a very attractive benefits package including 24 days annual leave, company pension and paid gym membership.

We are an equal opportunities employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

name: Technical Project Manager 🔥
title: Technical Project Manager 🔥
location: Medway House, Cantelupe Road, East Grinstead
description:
Salary 45,000 - 75,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- This role is only for someone with existing day to day delivery management experience in commercial outsourced custom software development within a consultancy or software house. If your main experience is internal delivery in enterprise-level organisations, change management, digital transformation, or any other form of program or project management, please do not apply for this role.




Responsibilities:

- You will directly manage between 1 and 5 software engineers and testers on each of your client projects, which will number around 5. You will own the delivery of quality bespoke Microsoft-stack solutions with tight control of scope and budget alongside constant client liaison.

Owning the end-to-end delivery of multiple software development projects of varying size and complexity in a dynamic and agile environment. Project size generally varies between 30 and 300 days effort Detailed day to day task and performance management of Software Engineers and Testers throughout the full PDLC. Maintaining and managing collaborative client relationships during the PDLC Strong management of budget, scope, tasks and timelines and effective mitigation of deviations.




Technologies:

- Azure
- Cloud
- Project Manager
- SQL
- ASP.NET



More:

A Technical Project Manager is required by a leading UK Microsoft Gold Partner Consultancy based in West Sussex.

Ballard Chalmers specialises in software design, development and ongoing support for enterprise systems on the Microsoft platform and deployed on the Microsoft Azure Cloud, as well as on-premises and hybrid systems. Our areas of expertise are: Microsoft .NET & Azure, SQL Server and BizTalk Server. With over 30 years of industry experience and as a Microsoft Gold Partner with 5 Gold Competencies, we have a well-earned reputation for delivering our expert services.

Profile

Absolute Attention to detail Apply your historic hands-on technical background to effectively manage and communicate at both business and technical level with clients and team. Able to produce detailed plans, reports, budgets and other documentation but the paperwork is a reflection of, and aid to, your detailed resource and client management. It is not your primary focus - managing the tasks and team is. Identify, confront and address issues across tech, scope, time and budget. Detailed practical experience and understanding of the pros and cons of different delivery methodologies and harness them appropriately (such as Agile and Waterfall). Self-managing across projects and priorities yet constantly communicating to the internal and external team so never chased for information.



This is for individual application only - strictly no agencies, please.

name: Embedded Sofware Engineer 🔥
title: Embedded Sofware Engineer 🔥
description:
Salary 75,000 - 95,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- 5 -10 years of Embedded C programming.
Good working knowledge of embedded RTOS.
Low level embedded processor/microcontroller.
Wireless technologies (ZigBee, Bluetooth, 3GPP, NBIoT, LTE-M).
Smart metering (DLMS, GBCS).




Responsibilities:

-

The successful candidate will be responsible for full life cycle development on IoT and Smart Energy product range, including:

o Requirement analysis
o Design
o Development
o Maintenance
o Continuous integration
o Configuration management
o Peer code inspection
o Task creation and tracking

You will develop and maintain the wireless technologies used in the the whole product range, including stack and application code.

You will understand secure coding techniques to ensure the product range meets the required industry standards for the relevant certifications and approvals.




Technologies:

- C
- .NET Core
- Bash



More:

Our client, a European specialist in embedded systems and IoT development is seeking an experienced embedded software development engineer to work on an exciting smart metering solutions project.

This is a small team of specialists working remotely.

name: Lead Backend Engineer 🔥
title: Lead Backend Engineer 🔥
description:
Salary 95,000 - 100,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Communication skills, ability to discuss product and technical issues with ease

Demonstrable managerial skills in coaching and mentoring team members

Fluency with Ruby, Rails and associated ecosystems

Strong understanding of modern service architecture, caching, and RESTful APIs

Familiar with JSON:API/Spraypaint




Responsibilities:

- Own the backend services powering our bespoke ecommerce subscription platform

Leading by example - this is a 80:20 leadership/individual contributor role

Architect, design and develop new features on our Ruby and Elixir powered backend services

Hiring and developing or long term permanent backend engineering team

Work closely with the product and design team to plan and deliver our product strategy




Technologies:

- Ruby
- Rails
- JSON
- API
- React



More:

WELCOME TO MINDFUL CHEF

An exciting opportunity to join the UK’s fastest growing and most loved recipe box company. Since starting in 2015 Mindful Chef has gone on to deliver over millions of meals across the UK. The business has shot to the top of Trustpilot's rankings making it officially the UK’s #1 rated recipe box and has the backing of big investors including Nestle. This is a rare opportunity to join this close-knit team with big ambitions.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

A proud B Corp we focus on using business as a force for good, balancing people and planet with profit. We are looking for a Lead Backend Engineer to join our engineering team. You will be happy working in a fast paced environment, have excellent attention to detail, strong communication skills and you are hungry to overcome challenges.

If you would like to join one of the UK’s fastest growing startups and make a positive impact on people's lives, we would love to hear from you.

name: Senior Frontend Engineer 🔥
title: Senior Frontend Engineer 🔥
description:
Salary 75,000 - 90,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Great communication skills, ability to discuss product and technical issues with ease

Experience with modern web development, using React/Next.js

Fluency with Javascript/Typescript and its ecosystem

Strong understanding of software design, caching, and RESTful APIs

Detailed understanding of how to reach appropriate test coverage for React apps




Responsibilities:

- Architect, design and develop new features on our React web app

Work closely with the product and design team to plan deliver on our product strategy

Improve the quality of our codebase and developer experience




Technologies:

- React
- JavaScript
- TypeScript
- Redux



More:

WELCOME TO MINDFUL CHEF

An exciting opportunity to join the UK’s fastest growing and most loved recipe box company. Since starting in 2015 Mindful Chef has gone on to deliver over millions of meals across the UK. The business has shot to the top of Trustpilot's rankings making it officially the UK’s #1 rated recipe box and has the backing of big investors including Nestle. This is a rare opportunity to join this close-knit team with big ambitions.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

We are currently looking for a Senior Frontend Engineer to join our growing tech team. You will be happy working in a fast paced environment, have excellent attention to detail and strong communication skills.

If you would like to join one of the UK’s fastest growing startups and make a positive impact on people's lives, we would love to hear from you.

- Great communication skills, ability to discuss product and technical issues with ease

Experience with modern web development, using React/Next.js

Work closely with the product and design team to plan deliver on our product strategy

Improve the quality of our codebase and developer experience

name: .Net Developer 🔥
title: .Net Developer 🔥
description:
Salary 30,000 - 45,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- - ambitious, passionate & creative
- quick learner and keen to develop own skills and knowledge
- actively seeks opportunities to push boundaries and explore new ideas
- inherent desire to deliver high quality work within required timeframe
- comfortable with ambiguity
- ability to focus on task at hand whilst maintaining awareness of overall project
- collaborative approach with excellent communication skills





Responsibilities:

- -
Translating user stories into functional web applications whilst delivering the best possible performance, quality and responsiveness of applications
-
Building .Net web applications using the Microsoft Stack designing and developing these layers of our applications
-
Designing, building & maintaining high quality, efficient, reusable and reliable code
-
Identifying bottlenecks and bugs and devising solutions to mitigate and address
-
Helping to maintain code quality, organisation and automatisation




Technologies:

- .NET Core
- ASP.NET
- Angular
- .NET Framework
- Azure
- Bootstrap
- C#
- Cloud
- Frontend
- Fullstack
- HTML5
- JavaScript
- MVC
- CSS
- Redgate
- SQL
- TSQL
- UX UI Design
- Xamarin
- jQuery



More:

We listen – we challenge – we deliver - and that applies to our employees as well as our clients. Our aim is to create an environment where you can perform at your highest, deliver your best and realise your full potential. We have recently expanded onto a 2nd floor and our spacious office is set up to give you space for innovative thinking whilst also facilitating collaborative working & creative debate.

We work hard but we also like to have fun! We hold regular quiz nights, social events plus ‘breakfast bonanzas’, ‘chippy Wednesdays’, ‘junk food Fridays’ and more....

But don’t just take our word for it, these are some of the things our employees think about working at Red Fish…

“I like that we are one big team who all have each-other's backs and don't expect anything in return. We all have a real laugh and enjoy spending time with each other at our company socials. The office banter is unmatched and the relaxed but hardworking atmosphere makes it a pleasure to work here.”

“I enjoy working at Red Fish as I feel they genuinely care about my well-being, both personally and professionally.”

“What I like about working for Red Fish is that it is a fun and relaxed atmosphere, and its one big happy family”

“The best thing about working at Red Fish is the People. The challenges keep you learning as well.”​

Redfish Systems Ltd is committed to equality of opportunity for all staff and we will treat all candidates equally irrespective of sex, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marital or civil partnership status, age, disability, colour, race, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, political beliefs or membership or non-membership of a Trade Union. Redfish Systems Ltd will ensure that each candidate is assessed only in accordance with their merits, qualification and ability to perform the duties required by the role.

name: Front End Mobile Developer (Flutter) 🔥
title: Front End Mobile Developer (Flutter) 🔥
description:
Salary 50,000 - 80,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- We are looking for a Front End Software Developer to join our Engineering team and take on full responsibility for building innovative tech solutions. You will lead in helping to build out the MVP further, continuously drive innovation by proposing and building new features aligned with our customer needs, contributing to design and implement our data and artificial intelligence strategy (if desired). We are looking for:

1. Strong knowledge/experience with:
• Flutter, (Kotlin also preferable)
• Google App Engine, Google Compute Engine
2. Goal orientation, ability to deliver results, driven by excellence. Track record building innovative tech solutions in a high performing culture and fast paced environment using agile methodologies and sprints, preferably in start-ups and scale-ups
3. Excellent attitude, proactivity, flexibility and desire to influence the creation of an exciting, high growth potential & purpose-driven business
4. Desire to get upskilled in new technologies and languages
5. Resourcefulness and troubleshooting aptitude. Attention to detail
6. BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field, preferably with strong academic background
7. Strong cultural fit (see values & culture at the end)




Responsibilities:

- Are you looking for an opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment and advance your career by working with top talent in London, New York, and San Francisco, working with the latest emerging technology including AI, and taking on new challenges?

If you are an ambitious self-starter with a strong track record scaling innovative tech companies through innovative technology solutions who wants to be part of the leadership team of a very innovative and highly scalable early-stage AI tech start-up disrupting the Future of Work and the Job Market we have the perfect job for you.

About Crowth!

Crowth! (https://www.crowth.org/) is an ambitious AI start-up with a huge mission: to tackle disruption in the job market caused by Artificial Intelligence/COVID19 to help people and companies be engaged and successful in the next decades. We are building a PEOPLE FIRST job market in the post-pandemic and Artificial Intelligence era, starting by disrupting job searching. Crowth! empowers people and makes it easy for them to help each other when looking for jobs and talent.

We are in stealth mode (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stealth_mode). What does this mean? After two years secretively building the disruptive and innovative platform and products with an amazing team of freelancers, getting our technology and designs patented across the US, UK, EU, and other countries, achieving product-market fit, and starting building our demand and supply we are ready to scale and build a first-class team of talented equally passionate people about our mission and vision and who are willing to fight to make the vision a reality. (https://www.forbes.com/sites/jiawertz/2019/01/30/stealth-mode-best-growth-tactic-startup-business/?sh=13be14f71240)

Backed by a very experienced team of advisors and mentors including the ex-Chief of Investment at America Moviles, the ex-Chairman of Jumia ‘The Amazon of Africa’ (recently IPOd) and the UK’s ‘Data Scientist of the Year’ (2019) and ‘Cloud Leader of the Year’ (2018) by Tech Leaders Awards among others. Currently targeting £7m round and finalising fundraising conversations with leading VCs and Angel Investors.

We pride ourselves on cultivating a working environment based on drive, excellence, boldness, openness to change, trust and a lot of laughter. As a rapidly growing company, we are on the lookout for ambitious and goal-orientated self-starters who align with Crowth!’s vision and culture.

The CEO (linkedin.com/in/nataliademiguel1) is so passionate and heart-driven about disrupting job searching and transforming the workplace in the interest of all of us. She has been named Exceptional Women of Excellence by Women Economic Forum (2020), AI Leader of the Year by Tech Leaders Awards (2018), Finalist of the Editorial Award by Women in Tech Awards (2018), and more recently one of the 10 Most Ambitious Business Women Making a Difference in 2021 by InspireZones (2021). She was previously a high-performing and high-potential team member across many leading organizations including Consulting Firms and has been described as highly courageous, determined, and visionary person.




Technologies:

- Flutter
- Kotlin
- Dart
- Frontend
- Mobile
- GitHub
- Figma



More:

Crowth!’s values

Determination: we are passionate, driven and full of purpose to achieve our vision
Excellence: we aim at being extremely good at what we do and together bring outstanding products to people
Boldness: we are courageous, we take risks and action and push boundaries. We empower our people
Openness to change: we help people understand the change, we inspire them and support them to act. We do and think differently
Trust: we will never ever compromise our company’s trust with clients, employees and society; we fly to achieve our vision but we care about people

Crowth!’s Culture

Meritocratic: striving for excellence and proactivity and rewarding the best
Transparent: free flow of constructive feedback and opinions in real-time
Flexible: employees can work remotely and flexibly. Teams assemble and stop quickly to achieve specific goals
Speed: a bias for action, agility and proactivity
Connections: we aim at connecting and collaborating with every single person and company in the planet and help them collaborate

title: VP of Engineering Flutter,Node.js/javascript 🔥

Requirements:

- We are looking for a VP of Engineering / Technical Lead to take on full responsibility for leading the technology strategy and the team to develop innovative tech solutions. You will be responsible for maintaining the strategic focus of the project while being in charge of developing the product following the most reliable development practices, driving continuous innovation by proposing and building new features aligned with our customer needs, contributing to design, and building out the technology team. 1.
Proven experience as a VP of Engineering, Technical Lead/ Team Lead in start-ups/fast-paced environment or clear potential to emerge into leadership role in a global highly scalable start-up

Great technical skills and thorough understanding of the software development process and life cycle, agile methodologies and proven experience incorporating strategies to accelerate time-to-market. Exceptional track record building and implementing end-to-end mobile app projects, and particularly Flutter (Kotlin also preferable)
3.
Well-versed in multiple mobile app technologies (Flutter, Kotlin also preferable, node.js, javascript; PostgreSQL; Google App Engine, Kubernetes), current technological trends, and familiar with a variety of business areas to build and understand strategy. Willingness to upskill and gain knowledge about AI
4.
Great leadership skills, capable of managing, coaching and developing a top performing team of software engineers and developers

Excellent attitude, proactivity, flexibility, and desire to influence the creation of an exciting, high growth potential & purpose-driven business

Understanding of budgets and business-planning, strong communication, and organizational and project management skills. Ability to deal with high levels of responsibility, strategic decision-making, multi-tasking, and high-pressure situations

BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, preferably with strong academic background

name: Cloud Engineer - Microsoft Azure 🔥
title: Cloud Engineer - Microsoft Azure 🔥
description:
Salary 40,000 - 60,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

-
•
As a guide your Cloud technology experience is 3 years+ and your overall industry experience is 5 years+
•
Eligible to work in the UK, and therefore do not need to obtain an employment visa.




Responsibilities:

- •
Microsoft Azure platform design, engineering, and deployment. You have experience of the end-to-end delivery process from requirements through design through deployment.
•
Strong Azure automation skills ideally with Hashicorp Terraform or similar. Proficient with Infrastructure as code and managing via source control.
•
In-depth skills with the Azure CLI and PowerShell. You lean on these tools rather than the Azure UI.
•
Excellent Azure foundational platform and core infrastructure engineering skills. You have designed and deployed the Azure “scaffolding” – networking, tenant, subscriptions, resource groups, vnets, security, firewalls/NSG, identity and access management.




Technologies:

- Ansible
- Azure
- Terraform
- PowerShell
- Docker
- Kubernetes
- OpenShift
- Cloud
- Grafana



More:

BlakYaks are a dedicated Microsoft Azure partner, focused on building high quality, secure, compliant Azure hosted container, serverless and PaaS platforms.
An opportunity exists for an experienced Azure Cloud engineer to join a young, energetic, London based cloud technology business that is entirely focused on building Microsoft Azure-hosted enterprise-grade container, serverless and PaaS platforms with elegant automation. The ideal candidate already works in a Cloud professional services business and has experience delivering cloud projects to large clients.

The role will include a mixture of working on client site, working from home and working in a BlakYaks office in London (as Covid-19 restrictions lift).
The job comes with an industry-competitive salary and includes equity participation.

The base pay range is from £40,000 to £60,000 per year depending on your level of experience and how relevant that experience is in supporting BlakYaks growth strategy.

Here at BlakYaks we aim to build an inclusive team where everyone can share their ideas and we encourage and welcome applications from all cultures, backgrounds and experiences.
desc:
Salary 40,000 - 60,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

-
•
As a guide your Cloud technology experience is 3 years+ and your overall industry experience is 5 years+
•
Eligible to work in the UK, and therefore do not need to obtain an employment visa.




Responsibilities:

- •
Microsoft Azure platform design, engineering, and deployment. You have experience of the end-to-end delivery process from requirements through design through deployment.
•
Strong Azure automation skills ideally with Hashicorp Terraform or similar. Proficient with Infrastructure as code and managing via source control.
•
In-depth skills with the Azure CLI and PowerShell. You lean on these tools rather than the Azure UI.
•
Excellent Azure foundational platform and core infrastructure engineering skills. You have designed and deployed the Azure “scaffolding” – networking, tenant, subscriptions, resource groups, vnets, security, firewalls/NSG, identity and access management.




Technologies:

- Ansible
- Azure
- Terraform
- PowerShell
- Docker
- Kubernetes
- OpenShift
- Cloud
- Grafana



More:

BlakYaks are a dedicated Microsoft Azure partner, focused on building high quality, secure, compliant Azure hosted container, serverless and PaaS platforms.
An opportunity exists for an experienced Azure Cloud engineer to join a young, energetic, London based cloud technology business that is entirely focused on building Microsoft Azure-hosted enterprise-grade container, serverless and PaaS platforms with elegant automation. The ideal candidate already works in a Cloud professional services business and has experience delivering cloud projects to large clients.

The role will include a mixture of working on client site, working from home and working in a BlakYaks office in London (as Covid-19 restrictions lift).
The job comes with an industry-competitive salary and includes equity participation.

The base pay range is from £40,000 to £60,000 per year depending on your level of experience and how relevant that experience is in supporting BlakYaks growth strategy.

Here at BlakYaks we aim to build an inclusive team where everyone can share their ideas and we encourage and welcome applications from all cultures, backgrounds and experiences.

name: FullStack Mobile Engineer Node.js, javascript 🔥
title: FullStack Mobile Engineer Node.js, javascript 🔥
description:
Salary 50,000 - 80,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Are you looking for an opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment and advance your career by working with top talent in London, New York and San Francisco, working with the latest emerging technology including AI and taking on new challenges?

If you are an ambitious self-starter with a strong track record scaling innovative tech companies through innovative technology solutions who wants to be part of the leadership team of a very innovative and highly scalable early-stage AI tech start-up disrupting the Future of Work and the Job Market we have the perfect job for you.

About the Role

We are looking for a Full Stack Software Developer to join our Engineering team and take on full responsibility for building innovative tech solutions. You will lead in helping to build out the MVP further, continuously drive innovation by proposing and building new features aligned with our customer needs, contributing to design and implement our data and artificial intelligence strategy (if desired). We are looking for:

1. Strong knowledge/experience with:
• node.js, javascript
• PostgreSQL
• Flutter, (Kotlin also preferable)
• Google App Engine, Google Compute Engine
• If possible (not compulsory) some basic knowledge of Artificial Intelligence, building AI first products/organisations
2. Goal orientation, ability to deliver results, driven by excellence. Track record building innovative tech solutions in a high performing culture and fast paced environment using agile methodologies and sprints, preferably in start-ups and scale ups
3. Excellent attitude, proactivity, flexibility and desire to influence the creation of an exciting, high growth potential & purpose driven business
4. Desire to get upskilled in new technologies and languages
5. Resourcefulness and troubleshooting aptitude. Attention to detail
6. BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field, preferably with strong academic background
7. Strong cultural fit (see values & culture at the end)

What you will get in return

1.
Be part of a disruptive & innovative venture which aims at acting as a vehicle for change in society and the workplace
2.
Very competitive earnings and generous stock options highly geared towards first members of the management team
3.
A culture we are pride of!
4.
Opportunity to take on additional responsibility and new challenges as part of a high growth organisation with a highly scalable global product
5.
Bi-weekly team lunches with knowledge sharing & personal development sessions
6.
25 days per annum + birthday day off
7.
Yearly personal challenge & support to it
8.
Breakfast and fresh smoothies






Responsibilities:

- About Crowth!

Crowth! (https://www.crowth.org/) is an ambitious AI start-up with a huge mission: to tackle disruption in the job market caused by Artificial Intelligence/COVID19 to help people and companies be engaged and successful in the next decades. We are building a PEOPLE FIRST job market in the post-pandemic and Artificial Intelligence era, starting by disrupting job searching. Crowth! empowers people and makes it easy for them to help each other when looking for jobs and talent.

We are in stealth mode (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stealth_mode). What does this mean? After two years secretively building the disruptive and innovative platform and products with an amazing team of freelancers, getting our technology and designs patented across the US, UK, EU and other countries, achieving product market fit and starting building our demand and supply we are ready to scale and build a first class team of talented equally passionate people about our mission and vision and who are willing to fight to make the vision a reality. (https://www.forbes.com/sites/jiawertz/2019/01/30/stealth-mode-best-growth-tactic-startup-business/?sh=13be14f71240)

Backed by a very experienced team of advisors and mentors including the ex-Chief of Investment at America Moviles, the ex-Chairman of Jumia ‘The Amazon of Africa’ (recently IPOd) and the UK’s ‘Data Scientist of the Year’ (2019) and ‘Cloud Leader of the Year’ (2018) by Tech Leaders Awards among others. Currently targeting £7m round and finalising fundraising conversations with leading VCs and Angel Investors.

We pride ourselves on cultivating a working environment based on drive, excellence, boldness, openness to change, trust and a lot of laughter. As a rapidly growing company, we are on the lookout for ambitious and goal orientated self-starters who align with Crowth!’s vision and culture.

The CEO (linkedin.com/in/nataliademiguel1) is so passionate and heart driven about disrupting job searching and transforming the workplace in the interest of all of us. She has been named Exceptional Women of Excellence by Women Economic Forum (2020), AI Leader of the Year by Tech Leaders Awards (2018), Finalist of the Editorial Award by Women in Tech Awards (2018) and more recently one of the 10 Most Ambitious Business Women Making a Difference in 2021 by InspireZones (2021). She was previously a high performing and high potential team member across many leading organisations including Consulting Firms and has been described as highly courageous, determined, and visionary person.




Technologies:

- NodeJS
- JavaScript
- Fullstack
- Mobile
- Flutter
- Kotlin
- PostgreSQL
- Kubernetes



More:

Crowth!’s values

1.
Determination: we are passionate, driven and full of purpose to achieve our vision
2.
Excellence: we aim at being extremely good at what we do and together bring outstanding products to people
3.
Boldness: we are courageous, we take risks and action and push boundaries. We empower our people
4.
Openness to change: we help people understand the change, we inspire them and support them to act. We do and think differently
5.
Trust: we will never ever compromise our company’s trust with clients, employees and society; we fly to achieve our vision but we care about people

Crowth!’s Culture

1.
Meritocratic: striving for excellence and proactivity and rewarding the best
2.
Transparent: free flow of constructive feedback and opinions in real-time
3.
Flexible: employees can work remotely and flexibly. Teams assemble and stop quickly to achieve specific goals
4.
Speed: a bias for action, agility and proactivity
5.
Connections: we aim at connecting and collaborating with every single person and company in the planet and help them collaborate

name: Fullstack Developer 🔥
title: Fullstack Developer 🔥
description:
Salary 40,000 - 60,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Build and maintain secure APIs (GraphQL and REST)

· Use AWS to manage and deploy projects

· Plan your own development tasks and work to deadlines

· Identify the latest trends and technologies affecting our industry

· Evaluate important metrics that affect our target audience

· Work with the team to implement solutions to complex problems, working closely with the founders and chief commercial lead

· Work with company to build the team.




Responsibilities:

- Responsibilities:

You will write code that is vital to company growth, by coordinating with multiple stakeholders: founders, data science, frontend, sales, marketing, and customer success in order to fully understand what the final result needs to look like.




Technologies:

- AWS
- GraphQL
- NodeJS
- JavaScript



More:

It’s a stand-alone role initially, so you’ll enjoy autonomy and independence. You’ll get support from the founders, but we need you to ‘own this’.

You’ll join a fast-paced team where you will be testing, learning, and iterating as fast as you can.

The mission is to focus on great user experiences, while providing businesses with superior results.

name: [BackEnd Developer] 🔥
title: [BackEnd Developer] 🔥
description:
Salary 50,000 - 80,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- AWS, especially Serverless Framework and generally Lambda Functions
Variety of SQL and noSQL solutions: we use DynamoDB as our main data source and we replicate the data across to Elastic Search
REST APIs
Node.JS, version 12.0+
Above all, you have a pragmatic approach to testing, DevOps and systems observability.
Full stack background, you eat React.JS for breakfast




Responsibilities:

- You’ll collaborate and brainstorm solutions working alongside the Head of Engineering and existing full stack and systems engineers.
Continuously improve existing systems, improve test coverage, monitoring, restfulness of our APIs
Evolve the current APIs and Internal Dashboard capability
Improve the overall operability, monitoring, performance of their backend systems




Technologies:

- NodeJS
- AWS
- React



More:

Outstanding opportunity to join this exciting, highly innovative, and rapidly expanding start up in the mobile device market. With significant investment behind them, a team of 30 and trading all across the UK and Europe, this is a truly fast paced and exciting work environment.

name: Software Engineer  🔥
title: Software Engineer  🔥
description:
Salary 50,000 - 80,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- 🚀 Strong experience in Node.JS.
🚀 Strong knowledge of databases (SQL, GraphQL, NoSql etc).
🚀 Design, build and maintain scalable, reliable and performant systems.
🚀 Write secure, scalable, documented code with automated tests.
🚀 Experience working with and designing APIs.
🚀 Experience scaling products.
🚀 Agile development product mindset. Ability to create rapid prototypes and understand how these differ from production level code.
🚀 Test automation.
🚀 Some DevOps knowledge.




Responsibilities:

- You'll help to deliver the systems and APIs that power our business.
Designing, building and maintaining scalable, reliable and performant systems by introducing simplicity for our customers and internal teams.
We're looking for a strong Backend Engineer with NodeJs/JavaScript/Typescript experience and familiar with microservices. The Engineering team is small however make a huge impact and we are rapidly scaling!




Technologies:

- NodeJS
- JavaScript
- TypeScript
- microservices
- Backend
- API
- AWS
- SQL
- CI/CD
- DevOps



More:

🧬Who we are: 

Want to make a difference in this world and work on something meaningful? At Chronomics we enable people to quantify how their environment and lifestyle is affecting their health to live healthier and happier lives… all from their DNA. Right now we are also focusing our efforts on COVID-19 and have developed an innovative saliva based test and online platform. 
Chronomics is an ambitious health tech start-up that believes people should be in charge of their own health. Health management should be proactive, not reactive and it should be personalised. We are using longitudinal biological data to bring about this revolution. A revolution where not only will people be in control of their own future but also in control of how they contribute to the future of humanity through the use of their data.
This product is just the first step towards a platform technology that will serve as the interface between the biological and digital world. It's an incredibly exciting time to come on board where you can really make a difference.

As one of our Backend Engineers we will love you because…  
✔️ You're not married to one technology and choose the right tool for the job.
✔️ You have a product mindset and understand creating value, not features.
✔️ And most of all you're enthusiastic and get the job done.

Our Tech Stack:
☄️We believe in the right tool for the job but we are moving towards a full Typescript stack deployed via CI/CD to AWS. ☄️React JS/Native on the front end.
☄️Node on the backend (moving away from PHP monolithic to more event driven microservice architecture) with some Python sprinkled on for the more data science parts.
☄️On the database side MySql/Postgres and GraphQL.

Benefits:
What you can expect from us

💵 competitive salary
⏳ flexible hours and remote working
🏖 25 days of holiday (on top of bank holidays)
💻 choice of hardware
🏥 Opportunity to help share the future of predictive healthcare

Be your authentic self at work

As we go global, we want our team to reflect the diverse and multicultural world we live in. So, we choose to talk about Inclusion and Diversity [in that specific order] because we believe Diversity won’t be successful without Inclusion first. We build teams, cultivate leaders and create a company that’s the right fit for every person in it.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Please note, we don't accept applications from recruitment agencies - thank you!
